cfgApplication.description: Workspace features a unified user interface that empowers contact center employees to make their contact center truly dynamic by enabling them to respond in real-time to real-time information from a wide variety of touch points and channels. Workspace enhances internal communications, user performance and quality. Workspace features a task-driven flow of information based on roles that you assign to your agents.

parameter.name: <media-type>.auto-answer
parameter.displayName: Workitem - Auto Accept For Specific Workitem Channel
parameter.description: Specify whether a specific workitem interaction is automatically accepted when a Interaction Server Invite event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: <media-type>.auto-answer.enable-reject
parameter.displayName: Media Type - Enable Reject of a specific media type when Auto Answer with timer is configured
parameter.description: When the option '<media-type>.auto-answer' with matching media type is set to true and '<media-type>.auto-answer.timer' is greater than 0, this option specifies if the reject button should be enabled when the corresponding privilege is granted. Privilege InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canRejectCall, or InteractionWorkspace.<media-type>.canDecline for open media. Note that for outbound push-preview interactions, the applicable option is 'outbound.push-preview.auto-answer.enable-reject'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: <media-type>.auto-answer.timer
parameter.displayName: Media Type - Auto answer timer of a specific media type
parameter.description: When the option '<media-type>.auto-answer' with matching media type is set to true this option specifies the time in seconds after which the incoming interactions of this type is automatically answered. A value of 0 means immediate auto-answer. Note that for outbound push-preview interactions, the applicable option is 'outbound.push-preview.auto-answer.timer'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: any integer greater or equal to 0

parameter.name: <media-type>.contact-history.enable-combine-ixn-with-current
parameter.displayName: <media-type> - Contact History Enable Combine Interaction With Current
parameter.description: If an agent is already handling an interaction with a contact, this option specifies whether an in-progress interaction of the given media type, opened from the Contact History tab, is displayed in the current interaction view or in a separate case view. Note: you cannot display more than one Email interaction in the same view.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: <media-type>.prompt-for-done
parameter.description: Specifies if the application prompts a confirmation message when a user clicks the 'done' button. This option is only available for interaction open media. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: <media-type>.pull-from-history-isenabled
parameter.description:
Specifies whether it is possible to pull an interaction of the specified media type from Contact History.
This option is applicable only if at least one of the following privileges has been granted to the agent: "Contact - Can Pull From Queue", "Contact - Can Pull Interactions In Shared Workbins", "Contact - Can Pull Interactions In Workbins Not Owned By The User".
Before enabling this function for a given workitem media type, ensure with your plug-in vendor that this feature is correctly supported.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: <media-type>.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the path of the sound file that is played when interaction of type is ringing. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: <media-type>.toast-information-key
parameter.displayName: Workitem - Toast Information Key For Specific Workitem Channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the information area is displayed in the specified workitem channel interaction notification. This option provides the name of the attached data key that contains the information. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid attached data key name.

parameter.name: accessibility.<media-type>.focus-on-interaction-toast
parameter.displayName: Accessibility - Set Focus On Interaction Toast Of Specific Media Type
parameter.description: Specifies that all Interaction Notification views for the <media-type> receives the focus when they are displayed. When a value for this option is set, this option overrides the accessibility.focus-on-interaction-toast option. This option does not rely on the accessibility.visual-impairment-profile option; therefore, it applies to all configured agents, not just visually impaired agents.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: accessibility.agent-state-change-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the agent state change sound-configuration string. For example: "Sounds\bell.mp3|7|0|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
b) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: accessibility.disable-hyperlinks
parameter.description: Specifies whether processing and presenting hyperlinks in email, chat and SMS as active elements should be disabled or enabled. Some screen readers cause Workspace to become unresponsive when processing active hyperlinks.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: Next time an interaction containing an hyperlink is displayed.

parameter.name: accessibility.focus-on-interaction-toast
parameter.displayName: Accessibility - Set Focus On Interaction Toast
parameter.description: Specifies that all Interaction Notification views receive the focus when they are displayed. This option does not rely on the accessibility.visual-impairment-profile option; therefore, it applies to all configured agents, not just visually impaired agents.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: accessibility.interaction-state-change-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the interaction state change sound-configuration string. For example: "Sounds\chord.mp3|5|0|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
b) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: accessibility.visual-impairment-profile
parameter.description: Specifies whether the profile for visually impaired users is active. This option enables more interface elements to be focusable (accessible from keyboard navigation and mouse-over) so that they can be navigated from Screen Reader applications.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: accessibility.warning-message-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the warning message sound-configuration string. For example: "Sounds\warning.mp3|10|0|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
b) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound..
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: active-recording.voice.recorder-uri
parameter.displayName: Active Recording - Voice Recorder SIP URI
parameter.description: Specifies the URI of the voice recorder. Use this option if you will use a voice recorder other than the one that is configured in GVP.
parameter.valid-description: A string in format sip:host:port

parameter.name: active-recording.voice.recording-type
parameter.description:
Specifies the type of voice recording to be used. NETANN and MSML are supported.
  • NETANN: Legacy call recording using NETANN can be provided by Stream Manager or Genesys Media Server.
  • MSML (Active Recording): Call recording through Media Server Markup Language (MSML) is provided through Genesys Media Server only. For details about this type of recording, refer to “Call Recording—MSML-based” in the SIP Server Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: NETANN or MSML

parameter.name: agent-status.enabled-actions-by-channel
parameter.displayName: Agent Status - Enabled Actions By Channel
parameter.description: Defines the available agent state actions in "My Channels" contextual menu. The actions are displayed in the order in which they appear in the list.
parameter.valid-description: Comma-separated list of action names from the following list: Ready, NotReady, NotReadyReason, AfterCallWork, Dnd, LogOn, LogOff.

parameter.name: agent-status.enabled-actions-global
parameter.description: Defines the available agent states in the global Status menu. The agent state commands are displayed in the order in which they appear in the list.
parameter.valid-description: Ready,NotReady,Dnd,AfterCallWork,NotReadyReason,LogOn,LogOff

parameter.name: agent-status.not-ready-reasons
parameter.description: Defines the available reasons in the Agent Status menus (global and My Channels). The reason commands are displayed in the order in which they appear in the list.
parameter.valid-description: Comma-separated list of Action Code names of type "Not Ready"; empty means all not ready action codes are considered

parameter.name: alert.timeout
parameter.description: Specifies the duration, in seconds, of the contextual warning messages that are displayed in the windows of the application. The value 0 means that message notifications are not automatically closed and must be closed manually.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value greater than or equal to 0.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: application.available-layouts
parameter.description: Specifies which views are available, and which view is displayed on login. If the option is empty, the Main window is not accessible, and Interaction Worskspace starts in the system tray.
parameter.valid-description: main-window
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: application.secondary-audio-out-device
parameter.description: Specifies a secondary audio device on which to play the sounds that are configured with the option 'secondary' or 'both'. For example: 'Speakers' if the corresponding device system name contains this string.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters. And also Regular expressions characters (. $ ^ { [ ( | ) * + ? \). The special value '$AllNonDefault$' specify that the sound should be played on all non default audio devices.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: application.wiki-help-locale
parameter.displayName: Application - On Line Wiki Help Locale
parameter.description: Specifies the locale of the Workspace online help. When this option is left empty, Workspace tries to find the online help that corresponds with the current language selected by the agent. If set to a valid locale, Workspace accesses the online help of the specified language.
parameter.valid-description: A locale name based on format LanguageCode-CountryCode (ex: 'en-US').
parameter.effective-description: At next request to the online help.

parameter.name: application.wiki-help-welcome-page
parameter.displayName: Application - On Line Wiki Help Welcome Page
parameter.description: Specifies the URL of the Workspace help home page. When this option is specified, all access requests to the on-line help are redirected to this page.
parameter.valid-description: A valid web page URL.
parameter.effective-description: At next request to on-line help.

parameter.name: broadcast.color.high-priority
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the border of the Message view frames for high priority messages. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: broadcast.color.important-priority
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the border of the Message view frames for important priority messages. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: broadcast.color.low-priority
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the border of the Message view frames for low priority messages. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: broadcast.color.minimal-priority
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the border of the Message view frames for minimal priority messages. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: broadcast.color.normal-priority
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the border of the Message view frames for normal priority messages. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: broadcast.displayed-columns
parameter.description: Specifies the names of the columns that are displayed in the MyMessage view.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following: MessageTypeIcon, MessageType, Sender, Subject, Priority, Date, Topic, Id, any key of custom data
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: broadcast.dn
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of Communicatio​n DNs that are used for Broadcasting.
Workspace registers to the specified DNs when a correspondin​g TServer connection is configured in the application and then considers all messages sent on these connections.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of DN and switch names in the following format: dn_name@switch
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: broadcast.enable-removal
parameter.displayName: Broadcast - Message Types Permitted To Be Removed
parameter.description:
Specifies a comma separated list of message types, including custom message types, that an Agent is allowed to delete from the Message View.
    There are three pre-defined types:
  • system - internal system messages
  • public - any type other than system messages
  • all - all messages
parameter.valid-description: A comma separated list of message types.
parameter.effective-description: At next access to a message.

parameter.name: broadcast.enable-removal-priority
parameter.displayName: Broadcast - Message Priority Level Permitted To Be Removed
parameter.description: Specifies the highest message priority level that an agent is allowed to delete from the Message View.
parameter.valid-description: Select from the list Highest priority level enabled for removal
parameter.effective-description: At next access to a message.

parameter.name: broadcast.mark-read-timeout
parameter.description: Specifies the duration, in seconds, that the broadcast message tooltip is displayed before the message is marked as read. If the duration is 0, this feature is not applied; then, the message is not considered to be read until the agent selects it for reading.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: broadcast.message-content
parameter.description: Specifies the attributes that are displayed in the Broadcast Message window and in the item tooltip of the MyMessages view.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following: Subject, Sender, Priority, Date, Topic, Body, MessageType, Id, any key of custom data

parameter.name: broadcast.preview-timeout
parameter.description: Defines the duration, in seconds, that the preview of the broadcast message is displayed in the Information area of the Main Window. The value 0 means the Preview is not displayed.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: broadcast.sound.high-priority
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound configuration string of messages of type important. For example: "Sounds\HighMessage.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: when an interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: broadcast.sound.important-priority
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound-configuration string of a message of type important. For example: "Sounds\ImportantMessage.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: when the interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: broadcast.sound.low-priority
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound configuration string of messages of type important. For example: "Sounds\LowMessage.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: when an interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: broadcast.sound.minimal-priority
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound configuration string of messages of type important. For example: "Sounds\MinimalMessage.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: when an interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: broadcast.sound.normal-priority
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound configuration string of messages of type important. For example: "Sounds\NormalMessage.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stop it (I.e.: when an interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: broadcast.subscribed.topics
parameter.description: Specifies the list of topics to which agents can be subscribed. The key $Agent$ defines the username of the agent. The key $AgentGroup$ defines all agent groups of which the agent is a member.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of string
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: broadcast.system-messages-auto-mark-read
parameter.displayName: Broadcast - Automark System Messages As Read
parameter.description: Specifies that system messages are marked as "read" immediately after the interactive notification is displayed to prevent the Main Menu button from including them in the notification bullet counter.
parameter.valid-description: boolean
parameter.effective-description: At next change of counter value.

parameter.name: broadcast.toast-summary
parameter.description: Determines the attributes display in the broadcast message notification.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated of valid object types from the following: Sender, Priority, Subject, FewWords, Topic, MessageType, any key of custom

parameter.name: broadcast.value-business-attribute
parameter.description: A character string that specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Attribute Values that are used as an enumerated value for custom attribute of message.
parameter.valid-description: A valid Business Attribute name.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: callback.callback-information.content
parameter.description: Defines the Callback data that is displayed in the Callback Information Area. The Callback data entries are displayed in the order in which they appear in the list.
parameter.valid-description: A comma separated list of items within the following list: DesiredTime, Type, Number, Instructions.

parameter.name: callback.callback-information.frame-color
parameter.description: Specifies the background color of the Callback Information view header of Callback interactions. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: callback.callback-information.header-foreground-color
parameter.displayName: Callback - Callback Information Header Text Color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the Callback Information view header of Callback interactions. Example #FFFFFFFF for white color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: callback.callback-types-business-attribute
parameter.description: A character string that specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Attribute Values that are used as available "Callback Types" when scheduling a Callback.
parameter.valid-description: A valid Business Attribute Name.

parameter.name: callback.gms-url
parameter.description: Specifies the URL of the Genesys Mobile Server (GMS) that will be used for Callback requests.
parameter.valid-description: A valid URL in the following format: http://<gms-host>:<gms-port>/

parameter.name: callback.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the path of the sound file that is played when a Callback Preview Invitation is delivered to the agent. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: case-data.float-separator
parameter.description: Specifies the float separator that is used for Case Information. This option should be used when the decimal symbol in the regional settings of the agent workstation is different from the one provided by the database.
parameter.valid-description: A valid float separator. Typical float separators are: '.',',','\'

parameter.name: channel-information.window-title
parameter.description: Defines the title of the window that prompts for place and media login data that appears in the Windows Task Bar by specifying a string that contains the following field codes:$Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$, $Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $Window.Title$.
parameter.valid-description: $Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$.

parameter.name: chat.agent.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the agent in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.agent.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt for the messages entered by the agent in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.agent.text-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the agent in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.attachment-download-timeout
parameter.description: Defines the maximum duration, in seconds, of the download of an attachment. The value -1 means that there is no maximum time.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value between -1 and 3600.

parameter.name: chat.auto-answer
parameter.description: Specifies whether a chat interaction is automatically accepted and joined when a Interaction Server Invite event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.auto-mark-done-non-owner-agent
parameter.displayName: Chat - Auto Mark Done Non Owner Agent
parameter.description: Specifies whether the chat interactions are automatically closed if the non-owner agent (not the last agent connected to the interaction) left the conversation.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.auto-mark-done-non-owner-agent.timer
parameter.displayName: Chat - Auto Mark Done Non Owner Agent Timer
parameter.description: Specifies the time, in seconds, before a chat interaction auto closes if the agent is not the owner (not the last agent connected to the interaction) of the chat interaction.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chat.auto-mark-done-owner-agent
parameter.displayName: Chat - Auto Mark Done Owner Agent
parameter.description: Specifies whether the chat interactions are automatically closed if the owner agent (the last agent connected to the interaction) left the conversation.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.auto-mark-done-owner-agent.timer
parameter.displayName: Chat - Auto Mark Done Owner Agent Timer
parameter.description: Specifies the time, in seconds, before a chat interaction auto closes if the agent is the owner (the last agent connected to the interaction) of the chat interaction.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chat.client.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the client in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.client.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt of the messages entered by the target client in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.client.text-color
parameter.description: Color of the client text in the Chat view. The HTML format is used to set the value. I.e.: #FFFF0000 for a red color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.emojis-business-attribute
parameter.description: Specify Name of Business Attribute contained Emojis definition.
parameter.valid-description: Valid Name of Business Attribute.

parameter.name: chat.enable-auto-disconnect
parameter.description: Specifies whether the chat session is automatically disconnected if the agent is the last party remaining in the chat session.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.historical.maximum-age
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum range of time, in days, in which to search for previous interactions by the same contact to populate the Chat transcript from the contact history when the agent scrolls the transcript backward. A value of 0 means that previous chat messages cannot be accessed from chat transcript.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid positive integer. 0 means feature is disabled.

parameter.name: chat.max-attachments-files
parameter.description: The total maximum number of files that agents can attach to chat interaction. An error message is displayed to the agent if the total number of attached files exceeds this value. The value 0 means that there is no restriction.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid positive integer between 0 and 100. 0 means no limits.

parameter.name: chat.max-attachments-size
parameter.description: The total maximum number of megabytes of files that agents can attach to chat interaction. An error message is displayed to the agent if the total number of megabytes for all attached files exceeds this value. The value 0 means that there is no restriction.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid positive integer between 0 and 1000. 0 means no maximum.

parameter.name: chat.max-file-size
parameter.displayName: Chat - Maximum Size Of file to transfer
parameter.description: The maximum file size in kilobytes that agents can attach to chat interaction. An error message is displayed to the agent if the file size exceeds this value. The value 0 means that there is no restriction.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid positive integer between 0 and 1000000. 0 means no maximum.

parameter.name: chat.new-message-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the configuration string for the new Chat Message sound. For example: "Sounds\bell.mp3|7|0|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
b) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: chat.nickname
parameter.description:
Specifies the nickname that is used to join the chat session (presented to the customer) by a string that can contain regular characters and the following field codes: $Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.FullName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$AttachedData.Y$ (Y: attached data key name).
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.FullName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$AttachedData.Y$ (Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: chat.on-hold-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue where the chat interaction is placed when the agent hits the 'place chat on hold' button.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid Script name of type 'Interaction Queue'.
parameter.effective-description: At next interaction attempt to put chat in queue.

parameter.name: chat.other-agent.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the other agent in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.other-agent.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the target agent in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.other-agent.text-color
parameter.description: Color of the other agent text in the Chat view. The HTML format is used to set the value. I.e.: #FFFF0000 for a red color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.pending-response-to-customer
parameter.description: Defines two alarm thresholds, in seconds, that warn agents that they have a pending response to a chat from a customer. Three levels are displayed: before the warning time, between the warning time and the maximum time, and after the maximum time.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list value: warning time, maximum time

parameter.name: chat.pending-response-to-customer-bell
parameter.displayName: Chat - Pending Response to Customer Bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the configuration string for the new Chat Message pending response sound. For example: "Sounds\chord.mp3|7|0|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
b) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: chat.prompt-for-end
parameter.description: Specifies if application prompts a confirmation message when a user clicks the 'end' button. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.reconnect-attempts
parameter.description: Defines the number of reconnection attemps to the chat session to make in the case of a connection loss.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chat.reconnect-timeout
parameter.description: Specifies the duration, in seconds, between each attemp to reconnect to the chat session in the case of a connection loss.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chat.restricted-attachment-file-types
parameter.description: Specifies the list of file types that agents cannot attach to chat interaction. An error message is displayed to the agent if the file type is restricted. The corresponding file does not appear in the attachment list.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of restricted file extensions: exe, bat etc.

parameter.name: chat.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the path of the sound file that is played when Chat interaction is ringing. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: chat.show-attachment-image-thumbnail
parameter.description: Specify whether to present attached image file in chat transcript as image thumbnail, or as generic file in online session, interactions' history, or both.
parameter.valid-description: Select a value from the following list: never, always, online, history.

parameter.name: chat.show-unread-notification
parameter.description: Specifies whether unread message notification should be presented in chat transcript. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true,false

parameter.name: chat.system.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the system in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.system.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt of the messages entered by the system in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: chat.system.text-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text for system messages in the Chat view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range)..

parameter.name: chat.time-stamp
parameter.description: Specifies whether the time stamp is displayed in the Chat transcript area.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.toast-information-key
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Information area is displayed in the Chat interaction notification. The option specifies the name of the attached data key that contains the information. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.

parameter.name: chat.transcript-message-text-direction
parameter.description:
Specifies whether the chat transcript messages should be presented with a left-to-right (default) or a right-to-left layout.
This option should be used for chat interactions where the customer is posting messages in a right-to-left language.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy, as described in the Workspace Deployment Guide.
This option has no effect when Workspace when the option 'accessibility.visual-impairment-profile' is set to 'true'.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: ltr, rtl

parameter.name: chat.typing-isenabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether typing notification is enabled. It should be disabled for Chat Server lower than 8.0.1.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: chat.typing-timeout
parameter.description: Defines the duration, in seconds, that the typing notification is displayed after the last keystroke and before the agent or contact sends their message.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chatserver.addp.local-timeout
parameter.description:
Specifies the duration, in seconds, that Workspace sends polling signals to the Chat Server. The value 0 means this functionality is disabled.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chatserver.addp.remote-timeout
parameter.description:
Specifies the duration, in seconds, that Chat Server sends polling signals to Workspace. The value 0 means this functionality is disabled.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: chatserver.addp.trace-mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the level of logging for ADDP.
  • client: Select Trace On Client Side to turn on ADDP at the client. The client application will generate ADDP-related messages in its logs.
  • remote: Select Trace On Server Side to turn on ADDP at the server. The application will generate ADDP-related messages in its logs.
  • full: Select Trace On Both Sides to turn on ADDP at both the client and server. The Client and server applications will both generate ADDP-related messages in their logs.
  • off: Select Trace Is Turned Off to turn off ADDP tracing altogether. ADDP-related messages will not be generated.

    • This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list: client,remote,full,off

parameter.name: chatserver.ip-version
parameter.description:
Specifies Internet Protocol version preference for the connection to the Chat Server.
  • auto: Internet Protocol Version preference is specified in environment variable GCTI_CONN_IP_VERSION or key 'ip-version' in interactionworkspace.exe.config. If not specified in any of those 2 sources the value '4,6' is used.
  • 4,6: Force Internet Protocol Version to IPv4
  • 6,4: Force Internet Protocol Version to IPv6

This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list: auto, '4,6','6,4'

parameter.name: contact.all-interactions-default-time-filter-main
parameter.displayName: Contact - Interaction Search Default Time Filter
parameter.description:
Specifies which Time Filter is selected by default in the 'Interaction Search' view.
  • All: all interactions from Main UCS Data Base.
  • 1M: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 month ago.
  • 1W: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 week ago.
  • 1D: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 day ago.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: All, 1M, 1W, 1D
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.all-interactions-displayed-columns
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are displayed in the result list of the 'Interaction Search' view, for example: Status, Subject, StartDate, EndDate.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.all-interactions-displayed-columns-treeview
parameter.displayName: Contact - Interaction Search Displayed Columns (Tree View)
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are displayed in the tree view of the 'Interaction Search' view, for example: Status, Subject, StartDate, EndDate.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.all-interactions-quick-search-attributes
parameter.displayName: Contact - Interaction Search Quick Search Attributes
parameter.description: Specifies the interaction attributes that are used to search interactions in the quick search mode of the 'Interaction Search' view. Refer to Deployment Guide to get the definition of interaction attributes.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.available-directory-page-sizes
parameter.description: The possible values for number of rows per page in the contact directory search result view.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of numbers that define the number of rows per result page from which the agent can make selections.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.cache-timeout-delay
parameter.description: The delay, in seconds, before the cache of the result of a Universal Contact Server request is cleared.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer from 1 through 3600.

parameter.name: contact.date-search-types
parameter.description: The list of search types that are available for the agent to use to search the contact database by date.
parameter.valid-description: Select at least one from the list.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.default-directory-page-size
parameter.description: The default value for the number of rows per page in the contact directory search result view. The value must be defined in the option contact.available-directory-page-size
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer from 1 through 50.

parameter.name: contact.directory-advanced-default
parameter.description: Specifies the list of contact attributes that are presented by default in the advanced search form of the Contact Directory view. Once an agent has personalized the list of advanced search attributes the personalized list of attributes takes precedence over this option in the subsequent sessions.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to searchable contact field names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.directory-auto-append-star-to-search
parameter.displayName: Contact - Directory Auto Append Star To Search
parameter.description: Specifies whether Contact searched keywords are automatically appended with a '*' character to obtain a 'starts with' search behavior. When searching in languages such as Chinese or Japanese it is required to set this option to 'false' and setup a CJK Analyzer in Universal Contact Server."
parameter.valid-description: true or false

parameter.name: contact.directory-default-mode
parameter.displayName: Contact - Contact Directory Default Display Mode
parameter.description:
Specifies which view of the Contact Directory is displayed by default.
  • ListView: Quicker search performance and tokenized search items, but no sort on the result.
  • GridView: Results are sortable result, but the search is less powerful, and the search items are non-tokenized.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: ListView, GridView

parameter.name: contact.directory-displayed-columns
parameter.description: The list of contact fields displayed when the results of a contact search is rendered.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names corresponding to contact field names, for example: LastName, FirstName, PhoneNumber, EmailAddress.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.directory-enabled-modes
parameter.displayName: Contact - Contact Directory Enabled Display Modes
parameter.description:
Specifies which view of the Contact Directory can be selected.
  • ListView: Quicker search performance and tokenized search items, but no sort on the result. This view can be enabled only if the 'Contact' index is activated in UCS.
  • GridView: Results are sortable result, but the search is less powerful, and the search items are non-tokenized.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of views from the following list: ListView, GridView.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.directory-permissions.<ContactAttributeName>
parameter.description: This option can be used as a template to specify a contact attribute name (in a key) and the associated values (in a value) that is used to restrict the access of specific agents to the contact directory.
parameter.valid-description: In a key, a valid searchable contact attribute name. In a value, a comma-separated list of strings applicable to the specified contact attribute.

parameter.name: contact.directory-search-attributes
parameter.description: The list of Contact fields that can be used as search parameters
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to searchable contact field names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.directory-search-types
parameter.description: The list of search types that are available for the agent to use to search the contact database in advanced mode. Specifying the value 'contains' may have a performance impact on Universal Contact Server.
parameter.valid-description: A comma separated list of values of strings from this list: contains, begins-with, is.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.displayed-attributes
parameter.description: The list of Contact fields that are displayed when a Contact record is rendered.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to contact field names, for example: LastName, FirstName, PhoneNumber, EmailAddress.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.editable-attributes
parameter.description: The list of Contact attributes that can be changed by Agent. "Can Edit Contact" privilegy must be granted
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to contact field names, for example: LastName, FirstName, PhoneNumber, EmailAddress. Default Value is $All$
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history.filters-<attribute>
parameter.description: This option can be used as a template to specify an interaction attribute name (in a key) and the associated values (in a value) that is used to automatically filter any list of interactions displayed in 'Contact History', 'My History', and 'Interaction Search' views.
parameter.valid-description: In a key, a valid searchable interaction attribute name. In a value, a comma-separated list of strings that are applicable to the specified interaction attribute. In the value, a comma-separated list of strings applicable to the specified interaction attribute. Use the $All$ and $Other$ keywords to enable filtering on "all" or "other" values for this attribute.

parameter.name: contact.history.highlight-current-interaction
parameter.description: Specifies whether the current interaction is highlighted in the interactions list or tree of the Contact History view.
parameter.valid-description: true, false.

parameter.name: contact.history.media-filters
parameter.description: Specifies the list of media types that can be used to filter the 'Contact History', 'My History', and the result list of 'Interaction Search'.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value of valid media type names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history.voice-detail-attributes
parameter.description: The list of voice call attributes that are displayed History Details view.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to voice call: Date, Contact, PhoneNumber, Duration.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-advanced-default
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are presented by default in the advanced search form of the 'Contact History', 'My History' and 'Interaction Search' views. Once an agent has personalized the list of advanced search attributes the personalized list of attributes takes precedence over this option in the subsequent sessions.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attributes.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-auto-append-star-to-search
parameter.displayName: Contact - History Auto Append Star To Search
parameter.description: Specifies whether History searched keywords are automatically appended with a '*' character to obtain a 'starts with' search behavior. When searching in languages such as Chinese or Japanese it is required to set this option to 'false' and setup a CJK Analyzer in Universal Contact Server".
parameter.valid-description: true or false

parameter.name: contact.history-custom-attributes-search-types
parameter.description: Specifies whether an 'exact match' (is) or a 'starts with' (begins-with) mode is applied when an agent makes an interaction search with a custom attribute.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: begins-with, is
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-custom-attribute-values.<attribute-name>
parameter.description:
Defines a list of attribute value names that are used to present a drop down box containing valid values of custom interaction attributes in Advanced Search mode of 'Contact History', 'My History' and 'Interaction Search' views.
Use this option as a template and modify its name by replacing by an actual name of interaction attribute configured to be diplayed in advanced search view.
You can define a localizable display name to each of the possible values of this interaction attribute by creating the key 'Contacts.ContactDirectoryView.CustomAttribute..' in any dictionary file of the corresponding language and assigning it a 'Content' attribute containing the display name.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attributes.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-default-time-filter-main
parameter.displayName: Contact - Contact History Default Time Filter
parameter.description:
Specifies which Time Filter is selected by default in the 'Contact History' view when an agent accesses the main history data source.
  • All: all interactions from Main UCS Data Base.
  • 1M: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 month ago.
  • 1W: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 week ago.
  • 1D: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 day ago.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: All, 1M, 1W, 1D
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted, or at the next interaction.

parameter.name: contact.history-displayed-columns
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are displayed in the 'Contact History' view, for example: Status, Subject, StartDate, EndDate.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attributes.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-displayed-columns-treeview
parameter.displayName: Contact - Contact History Displayed Columns (Tree View)
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are displayed in the tree view of the 'Contact History' view, for example: Status, Subject, StartDate, EndDate, OwnerId.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-quick-search-attributes
parameter.displayName: Contact - Contact History Quick Search Attributes
parameter.description: Specifies the interaction attributes that are used to search interactions in the quick search mode of the 'Contact History' view. Refer to Deployment Guide to get the definition of interaction attributes.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-search-attribute-group.<group-name>
parameter.description:
Specifies a group of History search attributes.
Use this option as a template and modify its name by replacing the by an actual name of group that will appear in Advanced Search mode of 'Contact History', 'My History' and 'Interaction Search' views.
You can define a localizable display name to this group by creating the key 'Contacts.InteractionSearchView.Group.' in any dictionary file of the corresponding language and assigning it a 'String' attribute containing the display name.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attributes.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.history-search-attributes
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that an agent can use in the 'Advanced Search' mode of 'Contact History', 'My History' and 'Interaction Search' views.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Interaction attributes.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.last-called-agent.<media-type>.enable
parameter.description:
This option can be used as a template to a create a media specific option. When set to true, the attributes LastCalledAgent_EmployeeID, LastCalledAgent_TimeStamp, LCA_EmplID_ and LCA_TimeStamp_ of the contact are set in contact profile when an interaction of the given media type is presented to the Agent.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
Note: This option overwrites the contact.last-called-agent.enable option.
Use the 'voice-campaign' media-type to define the lookup behavior in the context of outbound campaign interactions.
parameter.valid-description: true,false

parameter.name: contact.last-called-agent.enable
parameter.description:
When set to true, the the attributes LastCalledAgent_EmployeeID, LastCalledAgent_TimeStamp, LCA_EmplID_ and LCA_TimeStamp_ of the contact are set in contact profile when an interaction is presented to the Agent.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
Note: This option is taken into account only when the option 'contact.last-called-agent.<media-type>.enable' is not defined for the applicable media type.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.<media-type>.auto-assign-mode
parameter.description:
Specifies contact lookup behavior if the contact lookup is enabled for the specified media type.
  • true: If there is only one contact in the UCS database, that contact is assigned automatically. If there are two or more contact in the UCS database, the first one is assigned to the interaction automatically.
  • false: If there is only one contact in the UCS database, that contact is assigned automatically. If there are two or more contacts, these are displayed in the Contact view of the interaction and the agent must either select one, search for a different contact, or create a new contact.
Use the 'voice-campaign' media-type to define the lookup behavior in the context of outbound campaign interactions. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true of false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.<media-type>.enable
parameter.description:
Activates the Workspace features that rely on Universal Contact Server (UCS) for contact lookup when an interaction of the given media type is presented to the Agent.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
Note: This option overwrites the contact.lookup.enable option. It is not taken into account when the attached data 'IdentifyCreateContact' is set in the interaction.
Use the 'voice-campaign' media-type to define the lookup behavior in the context of outbound campaign interactions.
parameter.valid-description: true,false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.<media-type>.enable-create-contact
parameter.displayName: Contact - Enable <media-type> Contact Creation on Lookup
parameter.description:
When contact lookup is enabled in the context of the current interaction, this option specifies that the Universal Contact Server (UCS) can create a contact if the initial search cannot find any existing contact.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
Note: This option overwrites the contact.lookup.enable-create-contact option. It is not taken into account when the attached data 'IdentifyCreateContact' is set in the interaction.
Use the 'voice-campaign' media-type to define the lookup and create behavior in the context of outbound campaign interactions.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.auto-assign-mode
parameter.description:
Specifies contact lookup behavior if the value of contact.lookup.enable is set to true.
  • true: If there is only one contact in the UCS database, that contact is assigned automatically. If there are two or more contact in the UCS database, the first one is assigned to the interaction automatically.
  • false: If there is only one contact in the UCS database, that contact is assigned automatically. If there are two or more contacts, these are displayed in the Contact view of the interaction and the agent must either select one, search for a different contact, or create a new contact.
Note: This option is taken into account only when the option 'contact.lookup.<media-type>.auto-assign-mode' is not defined for the applicable media type.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.enable
parameter.description:
Activates the Workspace features that rely on Universal Contact Server (UCS) for lookup contact when an interaction is presented to the Agent.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
Note: This option is taken into account only when attached data 'IdentifyCreateContact' is not set in the interaction and the option 'contact.lookup.<media-type>.enable' is not defined for the applicable media type.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.enable-create-contact
parameter.displayName: Contact - Enable Contact Creation on Lookup
parameter.description:
When contact look-up is enabled in the context of the current interaction, this option specifies that the Universal Contact Server (UCS) can create a contact if the initial search can not find any existing contact.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
Note: This option is taken into account only when attached data 'IdentifyCreateContact' is not set in the interaction and the option 'contact.lookup.<media-type>.enable-create-contact' is not defined for the applicable media type.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.lookup.voice.use-dialed-phone-number
parameter.displayName: Contact Lookup - Voice Use Dialed Phone Number
parameter.description:
When this option is set to 'true', Workspace executes the UCS "contact look-up" request using the 'normalized' value of the number manually dialed by the agent.
Note: the 'normalized' phone number is the resulting string after the execution of the logic configured by the option 'expression.phone-number.supported-characters' and before the option 'dial-plan-rule-' is applied.
When set to false, Workspace applies the contact look-up with the phone number returned by the T-Server in the 'EventDialing', which can contain the string transformed by the execution of the dialing rules.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.mandatory-attributes
parameter.description: The list of Contact fields that must be completed for a contact.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to contact field names, for example: LastName, FirstName, PhoneNumber, EmailAddress.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.metrics.enable-interactions-in-progress
parameter.displayName: Contact - Enable Interactions In Progress Metric
parameter.description: Activates the Workspace features that display the number of eServices interaction that are in progress in the current contact history.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.metrics.time-frame-customer-notification
parameter.displayName: Contact - Enable Recent Customer Interactions Metric
parameter.description: Specifies the search timeframe, in days, from which existing in-progress interactions are to be reported. If the value is set to <tt>0</tt>, the feature is disabled. If the value is set to a number that is greater than <tt>0</tt>, the feature that displays in the interaction view the number of interactions that were sent or received by the contact for the specified number of days is activated.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value meaning a number of days. If set to 0, no metrics area .

parameter.name: contact.multiple-value-attributes
parameter.description: A list of contact attributes that can support multiple values.
parameter.valid-description: A comma separated value list of Attribute Value names that correspond to contact field names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.multiple-value-attributes-enable-default-description
parameter.displayName: Contact - Multiple Value Attributes Enable Default Description
parameter.description: Specifies whether the default Business Attribute value of a drop-down list is automatically populated in the associated contact attribute field of the Contact Information tab. If set to true, the default value is set. If set to false, no value is set by default.
parameter.valid-description: true or false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.multi-value-attribute-display.<contact-attribute>
parameter.description: The list of fields that are used to display the Contact Attributes that can have multiple values. <contact-attribute> represents the name of the contact attribute. Only PhoneNumber is supported at the moment.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of fields from the following list: Value, Description.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.myhistory-default-time-filter-main
parameter.displayName: Contact – My History Default Time Filter
parameter.description:
Specifies which Time Filter is selected by default in the 'My History' view when an agent accesses the main history data source.
  • All: all interactions from Main UCS Data Base.
  • 1M: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 month ago.
  • 1W: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 week ago.
  • 1D: interactions from Main UCS Data Base that were created less than 1 day ago.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: All, 1M, 1W, 1D
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.myhistory-displayed-columns
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are displayed in the 'My History' view, for example: Status, Subject, StartDate, EndDate.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.myhistory-displayed-columns-treeview
parameter.displayName: Contact - My History Displayed Columns (Tree View)
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction attributes that are displayed in the tree view of the 'My History' view, for example: Status, Subject, StartDate, EndDate.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.myhistory-quick-search-attributes
parameter.displayName: Contact - My History Quick Search Attributes
parameter.description: Specifies the interaction attributes that are used to search interactions in the quick search mode of the 'My History' view. Refer to Deployment Guide to get the definition of interaction attributes.
