parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid interaction attribute names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: contact.threading-ucs-interaction.enable
parameter.description: Activates the Workspace feature that associates interactions that are submitted during multi-channel contact communication, such as <tt>smssession</tt>, in threads in Universal Contact Server history.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.timeout-delay
parameter.description: The delay, in seconds, before a UCS request times out.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer from 1 through 3600.

parameter.name: contact.ucs-interaction.<media-type>.enable-create
parameter.description:
Activates the Workspace feature that generates the interaction history in Universal Contact Server (UCS) based on the inbound and outbound interactions of type <media-type> handled by Workspace.
Note: The option is forced to the value false for the media-types email, chat, and smssession, as Media Server is responsible for submitting those interactions in UCS.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
This option replaces contact.ucs-interaction.enable
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.ucs-interaction.<media-type>.enable-lookup
parameter.description:
Activates the Workspace feature that looks up the history of existing interactions of the given <media-type> in Universal Contact Server (UCS) in order to update their content and status according to live interaction lifecycle.
Note: For the media type 'email', this option is forced to 'true'.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: contact.ucs-interaction.<media-type>.use-server-date
parameter.displayName: Contact - Use the Server Date Record Creation/Stop
parameter.description:
Specifies for the specified whether Workspace sets the start and end dates of interactions by using the time of the local agent workstation, or uses the date and time specified by Universal Contact Server (UCS) when it creates or updates an interaction record in UCS.
Use this option as a template and modify its name by replacing the by an actual media type defined in Management Framework.
Note: Depending on which UCS version you are using, setting this option to ‘true’ might generate an additional request to UCS when ‘mark done’ is set.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: dial-plan-rule-<name>
parameter.description:
Specifies a dial plan rule. This dial plan rules allows IW to transform the received digits into the actual digits that it uses to make the call. See description in deployment guide chapter XXX
Sample:
'5XXX=>4351707{$DIGITS} # This rule matches any 4-digit number starting with 5 and translates it to the number 43517075XXX'
'5002=>43517075002 # This rule matches the dialed number 5002' and translates it to the number 43517075002'
parameter.valid-description: pattern => digit translation # comment
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.auto-restore
parameter.displayName: Disaster Recovery - Auto-switchover Back To Preferred Site
parameter.description: Specifies whether agent should relogged in to the Preferred site as soon as it is available.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.disable-login-errors
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace should display media voice login errors in the Login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.enabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether Disaster Recovery functionality is activated for SIP Server, Configuration Server and Statistic Server connections. The Disaster Recovery is fully enabled on a particular connection only if the option 'interaction-workspace'/'disaster-recovery.site' is configured in the option of the corresponding server Application so that it matches the site names configured in Workspace options 'interaction-workspace'/'disaster-recovery.preferred-site' or 'interaction-workspace'/'disaster-recovery.peer-site'.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.eservices-random-delay-range
parameter.displayName: Disaster Recovery - e-Services Random Delay Range
parameter.description:
Specifies the maximum time interval, in seconds, between the Disaster Recovery e-Services site update notification (through option 'disaster-recovery.eservices-site') and the actual connection attempt to the Interaction Server (Proxy) and Universal Contact Server (Proxy) of the new site.
The actual interval is a random value between 0 and this maximum time.
parameter.valid-description: valid integer
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.eservices-site
parameter.description:
Specifies the name of the the site that is to be used when connecting to Interaction Server (Proxy) and Universal Contact Server (Proxy) in a Disaster Recovery environment.
The administrator must update this option to notify the system of the Disaster Recovery site switch-over.
The actual reconnection to the new Interaction Server (Proxy) and Universal Contact Server (Proxy) occurs after a random time between 0 and the value specified by the option 'disaster-recovery.eservices-random-delay-range'.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore, @ and space characters.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.peer-site
parameter.description: Specifies the site name to be used as the peer site when connecting to SIP Server, Configuration Server or Statistic Server in a Disaster Recovery environment.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore, @ and space characters.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.preferred-site
parameter.description: Specifies the site name to be used as the preferred site when connecting to SIP Server, Configuration Server or Statistic Server in a Disaster Recovery environment.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore, @ and space characters.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.restore-agent-state
parameter.displayName: Disaster Recovery - Restore State After Switchover
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace should restore last agent state after logging on to the reserved SIP Server HA pair after the current SIP Server HA pair fails.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.timeout
parameter.description:
Specifies the time in seconds to wait after the detection of the disconnection from current site of SIP Server, Configuration Server or Statistic Server before switching to the corresponding Disaster Recovery site.
  • Scope: Configuration Server, SIP Server, StatServer
parameter.valid-description: valid integer
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: disaster-recovery.wait-for-sipphone-timeout
parameter.displayName: Disaster Recovery - Time To Wait For Sip Phone Initialization
parameter.description: Specifies time in seconds during which an agent should wait for SipEndpoint before a disaster is considered. A value of 0 means no limit.
parameter.valid-description: valid integer 0 - means infinite
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: display-format.acd-queue.name
parameter.description: Defines the display format of ACD Queues by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $ACDQueue.Number$,$ACDQueue.Alias$,$ACDQueue.Location$,$ACDQueue.DictionaryValue$,$ACDQueue.AnnexValue$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $ACDQueue.Number$@$ACDQueue.Location$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $ACDQueue.Number$,$ACDQueue.Alias$,$ACDQueue.Location$,$ACDQueue.DictionaryValue$,$ACDQueue.AnnexValue$

parameter.name: display-format.action-code.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the action codes that are displayed in Global Agent Status Control and My Channels view by specifying a string that contains a combination of string and field codes.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $ActionCode.Name$, $ActionCode.DictionaryValue$, $ActionCode.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: display-format.agent-group.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the agent groups that are displayed in Team Communicator, My Statistics and Voice Mail by specifying a string that contains a combination of string and field codes.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $AgentGroup.Name$, $AgentGroup.DictionaryValue$, $AgentGroup.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: display-format.agent-name
parameter.description: Defines the display format of other agents tby specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Agent.FullName$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$.

parameter.name: display-format.business-attribute.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the business attributes that are displayed in Interaction View, Contact Directory, Contact Profile, Contact History, Media type, etc by specifying a string that contains a combination of string and field codes.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $BusinessAttribute.Name$, $BusinessAttribute.DisplayName$, $BusinessAttribute.Description$, $BusinessAttribute.DictionaryValue$, $BusinessAttribute.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: display-format.caller-name
parameter.description: Specifies the content of the 'Origin' field of the Case Information area. This option is enabled when the value of the interaction.case-data.content option contains the 'History' key. This content is typically used when placing an outbound call where the origin contains a string such as 'outbound call to xxx'. The content is populated based on attached data keys or contact attributes (if there is a contact) or outbound record fields (if there is an outbound record) that are defined by a string that contains the following field codes: $Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$,$OutboundRecord.PhoneType$,$OutboundRecord.PhoneNumber$,$OutboundRecordField.Z$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name, Z: name of custom outbound field). If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $Interaction.MainParty$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a composition of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$,$OutboundRecord.PhoneType$,$OutboundRecord.PhoneNumber$,$OutboundRecordField.Z$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name, Z: name of custom outbound field).

parameter.name: display-format.case-name-format
parameter.description: Defines the display format of the case label that is currently used by the application by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $Case.Id$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name). This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Case.Id$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name)

parameter.name: display-format.chat-agent-name
parameter.description:
Defines the display format of other agents by specifying a string that can contain regular characters as well as the following field codes: $ChatAgent.FullName$, $ChatAgent.Nickname$, $ChatAgent.UserName$,$ChatAgent.LastName$,$ChatAgent.FirstName$,$ChatAgent.EmployeeId$.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $ChatAgent.FullName$,$ChatAgent.Nickname$,$ChatAgent.UserName$,$ChatAgent.LastName$,$ChatAgent.FirstName$,$ChatAgent.EmployeeId$.

parameter.name: display-format.chat-customer-name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of party name by specifying a string that can contain regular characters as well as the following field codes: $Customer.Nickname$, $Contact.X$, $AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name). The content is populated based on contact attributes and attached data keys that are defined by a string that contains the following field codes: $Customer.Nickname$, $Contact.X$, $AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name). This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Customer.Nickname$, $Contact.X$, $AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name)

parameter.name: display-format.contact-name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the contacts that are displayed in the Team Communicator and Contact Directory list views by specifying a string that contains a combination of string and field codes. The '|' character can be used to specify that fallback display rules are used in case the field codes do not contain any non-empty strings. Note: the FullName attribute is defined as a string of the string dictionary ('Display.Contact.Name.Format.FullName') which can be localized.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Contact.FirstName$,$Contact.LastName$,$Contact.FullName$,$Contact.PhoneNumber$,$Contact.EmailAddress$,$CustomContactAttribute.X$ (x: name of custom contact business attribute)

parameter.name: display-format.current-agent-name
parameter.description: Defines the display format of the agent that is currently using the application by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $Agent.UserName$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Agent.FullName$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$.

parameter.name: display-format.customer-name-format
parameter.description: Specifies the content of the text that represents the contact in the call participants area of the voice interaction interface. This option is applicable when a UCS Contact has been assigned either automatically or manually to the interaction. The content is populated based on contact attributes and attached data keys that are defined by a string that contains the following field codes: $Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name). This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Contact.X$ (X: name of contact attribute)

parameter.name: display-format.field.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the fields that are displayed in Record Information view.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Field.Name$, $Field.DictionaryValue$, $Field.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: display-format.folder.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the folders that are displayed in Disposition Code view and Case Data view.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Folder.Name$, $Folder.DictionaryValue$, $Folder.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-callback-name
parameter.displayName: Display Format - Web Callback Interaction Title
parameter.description: If the media type of the main interaction is Web Callback, this option defines the format of the tooltip presented when hovering the 'case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-chat-name
parameter.description: If the media type of the main interaction is Chat, this option specifies the format of the tooltip that is displayed when you place your mouse pointer on the 'Case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-email-name
parameter.description: If the media type of the main interaction is E-Mail, this option defines the format of the tooltip that is displayed when you place your mouse pointer on the 'Case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-im-name
parameter.description: If the media type of the main interaction is Instant Messaging, this option defines the format of the tooltip presented when hovering the 'case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$AttachedData.Y$(Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-outbound-pull-preview-name
parameter.displayName: Display Format - Outbound (Pull Preview) Interaction Title
parameter.description: If the main interaction is an Outbound Pull Preview, this option defines the format of the tooltip that is displayed when you place your mouse pointer on the 'Case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-outbound-push-preview-name
parameter.displayName: Display Format - Outbound (Push Preview) Interaction Title
parameter.description: If the main interaction is an Outbound Push Preview, this option defines the format of the tooltip that is displayed when you place your mouse pointer on the 'Case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-queue.name
parameter.description: Defines the display format of Interaction Queues by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $InteractionQueue.Name$,$InteractionQueue.Media$,$InteractionQueue.DictionaryValue$,$InteractionQueue.AnnexValue$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $InteractionQueue.Media$@$InteractionQueue.Name$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $InteractionQueue.DisplayName$,$InteractionQueue.Name$,$InteractionQueue.Media$,$InteractionQueue.DictionaryValue$,$InteractionQueue.AnnexValue$
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-sms-name
parameter.description: If the media type of the main interaction is SMS, this option defines the format of the tooltip that is displayed when you place you mouse on the 'Case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-voice-name
parameter.description: If the media type of the main interaction is Voice, this option defines the format of the tooltip presented when hovering the 'case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.interaction-workitem-name
parameter.description: If the main interaction is a Workitem, this option defines the format of the tooltip that is displayed when you place your mouse pointer on the 'Case' tab at the top of the window. It is specified by a string that contains the field codes listed in the valid description.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Interaction.Type$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: display-format.outbound-record-name
parameter.description: Specifies how an Outbound Record from a Record Chain is displayed when presented to an agent. The content is populated based on record attributes by a string that contains the following field codes: $OutboundRecord.PhoneType$,$OutboundRecord.PhoneNumber$,$OutboundRecordField.X$ (X: name of custom outbound field).
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $OutboundRecord.PhoneType$,$OutboundRecord.PhoneNumber$,$OutboundRecordField.X$ (X: name of custom outbound field).

parameter.name: display-format.party-name-format
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of parties which have not been identified as a customer or an agent, by specifying a string that contains either the name or the following field codes: $Party.DisplayName$ (the party phone number) or $AttachedData.Y$ (Y is the attached data key name where the value will be used as party name). This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters or field codes from the following list: $Party.DisplayName$,$AttachedData.Y$

parameter.name: display-format.routing-point.name
parameter.description: Defines the display format of Routing Points by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $RoutingPoint.Number$,$RoutingPoint.Alias$,$RoutingPoint.Location$,$RoutingPoint.DictionaryValue$,$RoutingPoint.AnnexValue$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $RoutingPoint.Number$@$RoutingPoint.Location$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $RoutingPoint.Number$,$RoutingPoint.Alias$,$RoutingPoint.Location$,$RoutingPoint.DictionaryValue$,$RoutingPoint.AnnexValue$

parameter.name: display-format.skill.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the skills that are displayed in Team Communicator by specifying a string that contains a combination of string and field codes.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Skill.Name$, $Skill.DictionaryValue$, $Skill.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: display-format.virtual-queue.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of Virtual Queues by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $VirtualQueue.Number$,$VirtualQueue.Alias$,$VirtualQueue.Location$,$VirtualQueue.DictionaryValue$,$VirtualQueue.AnnexValue$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $VirtualQueue.Number$@$VirtualQueue.Location$.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $VirtualQueue.Number$,$VirtualQueue.Alias$,$VirtualQueue.Location$,$VirtualQueue.DictionaryValue$,$VirtualQueue.AnnexValue$

parameter.name: display-format.workbin.name
parameter.description: Specifies the display format of the workbins that are displayed in Workbins view by specifying a string that contains a combination of string and field codes.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a compilation of characters and field codes from the following list: $Workbin.Name$, $Workbin.DisplayName$, $Workbin.DictionaryValue$, $Workbin.AnnexValue$.

parameter.name: editor.font-size-units
parameter.description: Specifies whether points or pixels are used for the units of font size in the Rich Editor view for e-mail and other rich text based interactions.
parameter.valid-description: A valid font size unit. The following units are supported: 'pixel', 'point'.

parameter.name: editor.shortcuts.prefix
parameter.description: Specifies a prefix to identify a keyword that is associted to a standard response.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string

parameter.name: editor.user-agent-http-header
parameter.displayName: GUI - Editor User Agent HTTP Header
parameter.description: Specifies the 'User-Agent' HTTP header value set in the HTTP requests used by rich text editor to download external images.
parameter.valid-description: A string representing a valid 'User-Agent' HTTP header according to RFC 1945.

parameter.name: email.attachment-download-timeout
parameter.description: Defines the maximum duration, in seconds, of the download or upload of an attachment. The value -1 means that there is no maximum time.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value between -1 and 3600.

parameter.name: email.auto-answer
parameter.description: Specifies whether an e-mail interaction is automatically accepted when a Interaction Server Invite event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.can-change-text-direction
parameter.description: Specifies whether it is possible to change text direction using the toolbar of email editor
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.default-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction queue in which new or reply outbound e-mails are submitted.
parameter.valid-description: A valid name of a Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: email.forward.enable-cc-addresses
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Forward As An Attachment - Enable Cc Addresses
parameter.description: Specifies whether it is possible to add cc addresses when forwarding an inbound e-mail as an attachment to an external resource.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.forward.enable-instructions
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Forward As An Attachment - Enable Instructions
parameter.description: Specifies whether it is possible for agents to add instructions when forwarding an inbound e-mail as an attachment to an external resource.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.forward.enable-multiple-to-addresses
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Forward As An Attachment - Enable Multiple To Addresses
parameter.description: Specifies whether it is possible to forward an inbound e-mail as an attachment to multiple external resources.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.forward-queue
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Forward As An Attachment - Queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which inbound e-mails are placed when an agent forwards an inbound e-mail as an attachment to an external resource.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: email.from-addresses
parameter.description: A character string that specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Attribute Values that are used as available 'from addresses' of E-Mail interactions. The value $EMAILSERVER$ specifies that 'from addresses' are populated from the 'POP client' sections of Email Server applications. The $EMAILSERVER$ value is applicable only if Workspace Application object has a connection configured to an Interaction Server to which the E-Mail Server is also connected. For example, this is not the case when Workspace connects to Interaction Server Proxies dedicated to Agents. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A valid Business Attribute name or $EMAILSERVER$.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: email.from-addresses.force-default-on-reply
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Force Default From Address On Reply
parameter.description: In environments where the option email.from-addresses is set to a valid Business Attribute name, this option specifies whether the default From address of a reply email interaction is the default value configured in the Business Attribute (true) or the target inbound mailbox of the parent inbound email interaction (false).
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: email.html-format
parameter.description: Specifies the format of a new outbound e-mail. When set to 'true', new e-mail will be formatted in HTML.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.include-original-text-in-reply
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Include Original Text In Reply
parameter.description: Specifies whether the text of the original incoming e-mail is included in the reply. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.include-standard-response-subject-on-insert
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Include Standard Response Subject On Insert
parameter.description: Specifies whether the subject of the Standard Response that is selected by the agent is included in the e-mail subject when an agent inserts the Standard Response in the e-mail interaction.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.inline-forward-prefix
parameter.description: "Specifies the prefix, if any, that is added at the beginning of the subject of the original email to be forwarded. Does not apply to emails forwarded as an attachment. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string.

parameter.name: email.inline-forward-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which outbound e-mails created for forwarding are placed when agents click 'Complete Forward'.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: email.mandatory-subject
parameter.description: Specifies whether the subject can be left blank (false) or if the agent must confirm if he/she wants to proceed with blank subject (prompt) or if presence of a non blank subject must be enforced (true
parameter.valid-description: >One value from this list: true, false or prompt.

parameter.name: email.max-attachments-size
parameter.description: The total maximum number of megabytes of files that agents can attach to an outbound e-mail interaction. An error message is displayed to the agent if the total number of megabytes for all attached files exceeds this value. The value 0 means that there is no restriction.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid positive integer. 0 means no maximum.

parameter.name: email.move-inbound-to-in-progress-workbin-on-reply
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Move Inbound E-mail To In Progress E-Mail Workbin On Reply
parameter.description: If the value of this option is set to 'true', when an agent replies or replies-all to an inbound e-mail interaction that is stored either in a personal in-progress or a shared workbin or in the Contact History, the inbound e-mail interaction is moved to the workbin that is configured as the in-progress workbin (refer to the 'workbin.email.in-progress' option).
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.outbound.copy-editable-case-data-in-inbound
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Сopy Editable Case Data In Inbound
parameter.description: Specifies whether editable case data is copied back to the original inbound email from an outgoing reply email interaction when it is sent. This option does not affect interim-send email interactions. If set to false, the original inbound email case data is not updated.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.outbound.editable-bcc-addresses
parameter.description: Specifies if an agent can add Bcc addresses to a new or reply or forward outbound e-mail or edit the list of existing Bcc addresses that would have been added by another agent in a former draft edition of the new or reply or forward outbound e-mail. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.outbound.editable-cc-addresses
parameter.description: Specifies if an agent can add Cc addresses to a new or reply or forward outbound e-mail or edit the list of existing Cc addresses of a reply outbound e-mail populated by Workspace at the time the agent clicked 'reply all'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.outbound.editable-to-addresses
parameter.description: Specifies if an agent can edit the list of 'To' addresses of a Reply Outbound E-Mail that is populated by Workspace at the time the agent clicked 'reply' or 'reply all'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.outbound-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which outbound e-mails are placed when agents click 'Send' or 'Send Interim'. This options is used only when Interaction Workflow does not set 'Queue for New Interactions' when it is routing Inbound E-mails to Agents.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: email.prompt-for-done
parameter.description: Specifies if application prompts a confirmation message when a user clicks the 'done' button. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.pull-from-history-isenabled
parameter.description:
Specifies whether it is possible to pull an E-Mail interaction from Contact History.

This option is applicable only if at least one of the following privileges has been granted to the agent: "Contact - Can Pull From Queue", "Contact - Can Pull Interactions In Shared Workbins", "Contact - Can Pull Interactions In Workbins Not Owned By The User".
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.qa-review-dispositions-business-attribute
parameter.displayName: E-mail - QA Review Disposition Business Attribute
parameter.description: A character string that specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Attribute Values that are used to populate the E-Mail QA Review Dispositions drop-down button (on the reviewer's desktop). This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.

parameter.name: email.quote-char
parameter.description: For plain text formatted outbound e-mails, specifies the characters that are used to quote the contents of the inbound e-mail interaction in the outbound e-mail interaction body.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string.

parameter.name: email.quote-header
parameter.description: Specifies the character string that is used to introduce the quoted inbound e-mail content in the body of the outbound e-mail. The following tags can be used: <contact>, <date>. These tags are replaced by the contact name and the date and time of the interaction when they appear in the outbound e-mail
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string.

parameter.name: email.reply-copy-category-id
parameter.description:
Specifies whether the Category ID of the reply outbound email should be copied in the parent inbound email.
Note: the CategoryId of the outbound email is typically specified based on the Category of the standard response that an agent inserts in this email.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.reply-format
parameter.displayName: E-mail - Format Of Outbound E-mail Reply
parameter.description:
Specifies the format of an outbound e-mail reply.
auto: outbound e-mail reply format is the same as corresponding inbound e-mail.
html: outbound e-mail reply format is forced to html.
plain-text: outbound e-mail reply format is forced to plain text.
parameter.valid-description: Select a value from the following list: auto, html, plain-text.

parameter.name: email.reply-prefix
parameter.description: Specifies the reply-prefix that is added to subject of the inbound e-mail. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string.

parameter.name: email.resend-prefix
parameter.description: Specifies the resend-prefix that is added to the subject of the outgoing email interaction that is created when an agent resends an outgoing or reply email from the History. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string.

parameter.name: email.restricted-attachment-file-types
parameter.description: Specifies the list of file extensions that represent file types that are to be prevented from being used as attachments. An error message is displayed to an agent who tries to attach a file that is not on the list of restricted types.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of restricted file extensions: exe, bat etc.

parameter.name: email.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the path of the sound file that is played when E-Mail interaction is ringing. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: email.set-ownerid-on-send
parameter.description: Specifies whether the owner id of the interaction should be updated with the dbid of the agent when the e-mail is sent. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: email.signature
parameter.description:
Specifies the type and the location of the signature template that is to be added to outbound e-mails. The value has two components that are separated by the character ':':
1) The type of signature template:
a) "file" for a file.
b) "response" for a response from the Standard Response Library.
2) The location of the signature template:
a) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. For example, "file:Signatures\Signature.txt".
b) The response name and full path of the parent category in the Standard Response Library. For example, "response:Signatures\Classic".
The selected Standard Response can contain the following field codes:
  • <$Agent.FirstName$>
  • <$Agent.LastName$>
  • <$Agent.FullName$>
  • <$Agent.Signature$>
    • This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: "file:" followed by the file path or "response:" followed by the reponse path in the SRL.

parameter.name: email.toast-information-key
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Information area is displayed in the E-Mail interaction notification. This option provides the name of the attached data key that contains the information. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid character string.

parameter.name: eservices.disconnect-on-logoff
parameter.description:
Description: When this option is set to true Workspace ensures that:
  • The connection to Interaction Server is not opened when no eServices media channel is selected at login time,
  • The connection to Interaction Server is closed when all eServices media channel are logged off during the session. This does not affect supervisors that have Queue or Team Workbin Management privileges.
This ensures that an eServices seat license is checked out only when a media is logged on by the agent or a supervisor privilege is granted to the user.
As a consequence an agent cannot see the content of his workbins when no media is logged on.
When this option is set to false (legacy behavior), Workspace connects to Interaction Server and log the agent on the place as soon as an eServices media privilege is granted to the agent.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: eservices.session-restore-mediatype
parameter.description:
Specifies the media types that are allowed to reconnect when a lost connection to Interaction Server is restored, as specified by the eservices.session-restore-timeout option.
Workspace will not try to reconnect any media types that are not specified by this option.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid media-type.

parameter.name: eservices.session-restore-timeout
parameter.description:
This option specifies the time in seconds after the interaction server reconnection to retrieve the ownership on interaction of type defined by the option eservices.session-restore-mediatype.
If the value 0 is specified, the interaction is automatically closed when connection to Interaction Server is lost.
The value of option has dependency following the value of option agent-session-restore-timeout of Interaction Server.
parameter.valid-description: any integer greater or equal to 0

parameter.name: expression.email-address
parameter.description: Specifies the regular expression to identify an e-mail address in the chat or SMS transcript. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A regular expression

parameter.name: expression.outbound-campaign-phone-number
parameter.description: Specifies the regular expression that identify if agent has entered a valid phone when he dials an Outbound Preview Record on a new phone number. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A regular expression

parameter.name: expression.phone-number
parameter.description: Specifies the regular expression to identify a phone number in the chat or SMS transcript. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A regular expression

parameter.name: expression.phone-number.supported-characters
parameter.description: Specifies the characters that are considered when building a request to the T-Server that relies on a phone number. Any other characters from the original string coming from the User Interface are removed. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. All special characters that are valid Windows file names.

parameter.name: expression.team-communicator-phone-number
parameter.description: Specifies the regular expression used to recognize a phone number of a target entered in the Team Communicator when it is used to start a call, a transfer, or a conference. If the number entered by the agent in the Team Communicator edit box matches this expression, the 'Call' or 'Start Voice Consultation' or 'Instant Transfer' or 'Instant Conference' action is enabled for this number. When the agent finally executes the action, the entered phone number is modified by the logic of the options 'expression.phone-number.supported-characters' and 'dial-plan-rule-<name>' before the actual telephony operation is executed.
parameter.valid-description: A regular expression
parameter.effective-description: At the next use of Team Communicator.

parameter.name: expression.url
parameter.description: Specifies the regular expression to identify an URL in Case Information area. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: A regular expression

parameter.name: gadget.window-title
parameter.description: Defines the title of the window in which the Gadget is rendered by specifying a string that contains the following field codes:$Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$. If all field codes are empty, the default string is $Window.Title$. This title is visible in the Task Bar only.
parameter.valid-description: $Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$.

parameter.name: gadget-statistics.displayed-call-center-statistics
parameter.displayName: Statistic Gadget - Displayed Contact Center Statistics
parameter.description: Specifies the statistics that are displayed in the Statistic Gadget. The statistics name refers to the names of the Application Options Sections that define the statistics.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Statistic names.

parameter.name: gadget-statistics.displayed-kpis
parameter.description: Specifies the KPIs that are displayed to the agent in the Statistic Gadget. The KPI names refer to the names of the Application Option Sections that are defining the KPIs.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of KPI names.

parameter.name: gadget-statistics.nb-tagged-stats-per-page
parameter.displayName: Statistic Gadget - Tagged Statistic Area Size
parameter.description: Defines the number of statistics that can be displayed in the non-scrolling region of the tagged statistics in the Statistics Gadget. If the number of statistics displayed is greater than this defined number, the remaining statistics are displayed in separate panels. The maximum value for this option is 10.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: an integer value

parameter.name: gadget-statistics.show
parameter.description: Set to true to show the gadget of statistics.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.configuration-agent-collection-loading-method
parameter.displayName: General - Configuration Agent Collection Loading Method
parameter.description:
Specifies the way Workspace retrieves the collection of agents from Configuration Server. This retrieval happens when option teamcommunicator.list-filter-showing contains the value ‘Agent’. Each retrieval method has pros and cons. The method selection must be done according to business requirements, system environment and scale constraints:
  • read-objects: This is the legacy agent retrieval model. This method returns the list of agents according to the ‘read’ permission of the current agent. But for each retrieved agent it returns the full agent data from Configuration Server, which includes annex structure in an uncompressed format. As a result the consumed bandwidth can be much bigger than the data set returned by the other retrieval method.
  • brief-info: For each retrieved agent, this method returns only a subset of the agent data and as a consequence can bring a real network bandwidth optimization, as well as a decrease of Configuration Server load. But Configuration Server ignores the ‘read’ permissions of the current agent when returning the list of object. So the Team Communicator will provide access to all the agents of the Tenant.
    Also this methods does not provide access to the field EmployeeID, so when displaying search results in Team Communicator the value $Agent.EmployeeID$ will be ignored when set in option display-format.agent-name.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list:read-objects,brief-info
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.configuration-business-attribute-cache-preload
parameter.displayName: General - Configuration Business Attribute Cache Preload
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of Business Attribute objects that are loaded and cached at login time.
If $All$ is configured, all the Business Attribute objects that are contained in the Agent’s Tenant and on which the Agent has Read Access, are pre-loaded at login time.
Pre-loading these objects means that dynamic access to Configuration Server during the critical phase of interaction notification is not required.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid Business Attribute object names or $All$.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.configuration-business-attribute-folder-cache-preload
parameter.displayName: General - Configuration Business Attribute Folder Cache Preload
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of Business Attributes containing a list of folders in the Business Attribute Values area to be loaded and cached at agent login.
Folders are used for tree structures in areas such as the Disposition tab and Case Data.
The Business Attributes containing folders must also be specified by the general.configuration-business-attribute-cache-preload option or the Business Attribute containing folders will not be preloaded.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid Business Attribute object names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.configuration-object-collection-cache-timeout
parameter.displayName: General - Configuration Object Collection Cache Timeout
parameter.description:
Specifies the amount of time, defined in hours, to keep the list of objects in a local cache file before requesting it again to Configuration Server. Once the timeout is expired Workspace request again the objects to Configuration Server at next Team Communicator initialization, which can be during next login session if Team Communicator is already initialized for the current session. Value '0' means that no local cache is created.
This list of objects is loaded and cached based on option teamcommunicator.list-filter-showing.
parameter.valid-description: Any positive integer value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.configuration-transaction-cache-preload
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of Transaction objects of type 'List' that are loaded and cached at login time.
If $All$ is configured, all the Transaction objects of type 'List' that are contained in the Agent’s Tenant and on which Agent has Read Access, are pre-loaded at login time.
Pre-loading these objects means that dynamic access to Configuration Server during the critical phase of interaction notification is not required.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid Transaction object names or $All$
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.configuration-update-notification
parameter.description: Specifies the list of configuration server objects that require notification when there is an update.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of one or more items that are to be notifed: None,All,ThisAgent,ThisApplication,ThisTenant,Transactions,Persons,Skills,AgentGroups,DN,BusinessAttributes,BusinessAttributeValues,Script
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: general.gad.attached-data
parameter.description: Specifies whether attached data is added to the equivalent of a Genesys Agent Desktop key. If routing is used, then Workspace adds the following keys: GD_TransferTargetType,GD_TransferTargetId,...
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: general.non-unicode-connection-encoding
parameter.description:
This option specifies the code page encoding that is used to connect to back-end servers that do not rely on Unicode communication (all back-end servers except UCS).
The possible values can be obtained from the “.Net Name” column of the Code Page Identifier that is defined in the following web page: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd317756(v=vs.85).aspx.
When this option is empty the applied encoding corresponds to the 'language for non unicode programs', that is also known as the 'system locale' of the agent workstation.
parameter.valid-description: .Net Name of Code Page Identifier
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: general.writable-downloaded-attachment-file-types
parameter.displayName: General - Writable Downloaded Attachment File Types
parameter.description: Specifies the list of attachment file types that are writable on the hard drive of the agent workstation once they are downloaded from UCS. It might be interesting to leave xls files read-only to avoid confusion about the attachment edition outcome, while making png attachments writable to enable easy rotation in third party image viewers.
parameter.valid-description: Comma-separated list of restricted file extensions: xls,png etc.

parameter.name: gui.editor-zoom-range
parameter.description: Defines the minimum and maximum editors and transcripts zoom value (this includes Email, Chat, SMS, IM, etc).
parameter.valid-description: Could be comma separated minimum maximum integer or a double values, single integer or a double value, or empty field. In case of comma separated minimum maximum values (if values ARE NOT equal), the zoom range will be set to these values, and zoom UI controls will be shown. In case of comma separated minimum maximum values (if values ARE equal), the zoom level will be set to this single value, and no zoom UI controls will be shown. In case of single value, the zoom level will be set to this single value, and no zoom UI controls will be shown. In case of empty value, the zoom level will be set to 100%, and no zoom UI controls will be shown. Values cannot be less than 10, and larger than 300. Default value is "100" (no zoom, and no no zoom UI controls).
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: gui.emoji-font-name
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the font which is used to render emojis in text editor and transcript of chat interactions.
parameter.valid-description: A valid font name installed on the workstation.

parameter.name: gui.magnification-factor
parameter.description: Specifies the ratio of the display size of interface elements in the Workspace interface to enable agents to view these interface elements at larger sizes.
parameter.valid-description: One value from the following list: normal (x1), medium (x1.25), large (x1.5), xlarge (x1.75).
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: gui.themes
parameter.description: Specifies the list of themes that are displayed in the Change Theme menu. If this option contains only one theme, that theme is applied by default, and the theme selection menu will not be included in the agent interface.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated of theme names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: im.agent.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt for the messages entered by the agent in the IM view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: im.agent.text-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the agent in the IM view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: im.auto-answer
parameter.displayName: IM - Auto Answer Incoming Instant Messaging
parameter.description: Specify whether a instant messaging interaction is automatically answered when a TServer Ringing event is received
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: im.new-message-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound configuration string for a new Instant Message. For example: "Sounds\bell.mp3|7|0|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
b) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: im.other-agent.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the target agent in the IM view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: im.other-agent.text-color
parameter.description: Color of the other agent text in the IM view. The HTML format is used to set the value. I.e.: #FFFF0000 for a red color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: im.prompt-for-end
parameter.description: Specify if application prompts a confirmation message when user clicks the 'end' button. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: im.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the im channel ringing sound-configuration string. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: im.system.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt for the system messages in the IM view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: im.system.text-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text for the system messages in the IM view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: im.time-stamp
parameter.description: Specify whether the time stamp is displayed in the transcript area.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: im.toast-timeout
parameter.description: Defines the duration, in seconds, that the IM interaction notification is displayed in the Information area of the Main Window before the IM is rejected. The value 0 means the interaction notification is displayed until the agent accepts the interaction.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: interaction.auto-focus
parameter.description: Specifies whether the inbound interaction should be in focus automatically when it is accepted.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction.auto-focus.<media-type>
parameter.description: Specifies whether the inbound interaction of a particular media type should be in focus automatically when is accepted. When it is defined for a media type this option overwrites the definition of generic option "interaction.auto-focus".
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction.case-data.content
parameter.description:
Defines the content of the Case Information area. The CaseData key enables the display of the attached data that is defined by the interaction.case-data.format-business-attribute option. The History key enables the display of interaction history information like the Origin field. The order of the values defines the order of the Case Data and History information in the Case Information area.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy, as described in the Workspace Deployment Guide.
Starting from the 8.1.1 release, this option no longer controls the display of case information in the toast view. Please refer to the toast.case-data.content option for this purpose."

parameter.name: interaction.case-data.enable-url-preview
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Case Information Enable URL Preview
parameter.description:
Enables the display of a preview of the web page that is linked from URLs that are part of the case information. See also the 'expression.url' option.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy, as described in the Workspace Deployment Guide."
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.case-data.format-business-attribute
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Case Information Format Business Attribute
parameter.description:
Specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Business Attribute Values that are used to filter and render attached data in the interaction.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
You can define the display order of Business Attribute Values by creating an interaction-workspace section in the annex of the Business Attribute, then add the interaction.case-data.order option. This option is a comma-separated list of Business Attributes Value Names that specifies the order of the Business Attribute Values. The Attributes Values that are not listed in interaction.case-data.order option are put at the bottom of the list.
Starting from 8.1.1 release this option does not control anymore the display of case information in the toast view. Please refer to option toast.case-data.format-business-attribute for this purpose.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.

parameter.name: interaction.case-data.frame-color
parameter.description: Specifies the background color of the Case Information view header. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: interaction.case-data.header-foreground-color
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Case Information Header Text Color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the Case Information view header. Example #FFFFFFFF for white color This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: interaction.case-data.is-read-only-on-idle
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Case Information Is Read-only On Idle
parameter.description: If the value of this option is true, changes to the Case Information after a voice interaction has been released are prevented. When some values are modified or added after the voice call is released, the update is pushed to back-end as a User Event when agent clicks 'Mark Done'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in the Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.consult-user-data
parameter.description:
Defines if and how the business data (original interaction user data, contact identifier,…) of the customer interaction is shared in a consultation interaction.
  • none: No data is shared in the consultation.
  • public: User data of the customer interaction is shared in the consultation. The user data is copied at the root level of the consultation user data. Keys that start with an underscore are not copied into the consultation leg.
  • private: User data of the customer interaction is shared in the consultation. The user data is copied in a sub-list of the consultation user data, named ‘SharedInformation’. Keys that start with an underscore are not copied into the consultation leg. This is Workspace 8.1.0 compatibility mode.

In modes 'public' and 'private' the keys starting with an underscore are not copied into the consultation leg.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Select a value from the following list: public, private, none

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.display-mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the presentation model of the view where the agent can select interaction's disposition code.
  • tree-view: The disposition codes are presented within a hierarchy of folders. Agent can search for disposition codes.
  • radio-buttons: The disposition codes are presented in a flat radio button style list (legacy mode).
parameter.valid-description: Select one value from the following list: tree-view,radio-buttons
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.email.mandatory-actions
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Email Actions Validating Mandatory Data
parameter.description: Some email interaction actions, such as Transfer and Forward as an attachment, have an uncertain final status. This option enables you to specify whether the mandatory editable data must be completed by the agent before applying a Transfer and/or a Forward as an attachment action. If Transfer and/or Forward are specified, agents must first set a mandatory disposition code, if specified by the interaction.disposition.is-mandatory option, and/or complete case information that is configured as mandatory before they can transfer and/or forward as an attachment an email interaction. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Comma separated list of actions from the following list: Transfer, Forward.
parameter.effective-description: The next time an agent transfers and/or forwards an e-mail interaction.

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.is-mandatory
parameter.description: Specify whether it is mandatory for the agent to set a disposition code before Marking Done an interaction. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.is-read-only-on-idle
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Disposition Is Read-only On Idle
parameter.description: Prevents changes to the disposition code after a voice interation has been released. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.key-name
parameter.description: The key that is used to populate attached data or a user event when a disposition code is submitted to the back-end system, such as T-Server, Interaction Server, and Contact Server. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.use-attached-data
parameter.description: Enables the adding of attached data from the interaction in UserEvent. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.use-connection-id
parameter.description: Specifies whether the connection id is sent as part of the user event that is sent for disposition code. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.disposition.value-business-attribute
parameter.description:
A character string that specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Attribute Values that are used as an enumerated value for a disposition code
Beginning with release 8.5, you can specify the display order of Business Attribute Values by creating an interaction-workspace section in the annex of the Business Attribute, and then add the interaction.disposition.order option.
This option contains a comma-separated list of Business Attributes Value Names that specifies the order of the Business Attribute Values. The Attributes Values that are not specified by the interaction.disposition.order option are put at the bottom of the list, except for the value None, which it is always the first item.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.

parameter.name: interaction.evaluate-real-party-for-agent
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace attempts to transform the name of the party DN into an Agent name during a voice interaction.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction.evaluate-real-party-for-agent.expression
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Evaluate Real Party For Agent Expression
parameter.description:
In environment where interaction.evaluate-real-party-for-agent=true this option specifies a regular expression used to match the parties a voice call that should be evaluated in order to be transformed into a real agent name.
For example, in environment where agent's DNs are defined by a 7-digit number starting with a 7 or 8, the option would be set with value: "^[78]\d{6}
parameter.valid-description: A regular expression
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction.override-option-key
parameter.description: Enables overriding of certain application options by using one or several transaction objects. This option provides the key name of the attached data that contains the list of transaction objects. Note: the key named in this option will not be copied into any interaction created from the current interation, like consultations, e-mail replies, etc.
parameter.valid-description: An attached data key name (string).

parameter.name: interaction.reject-route
parameter.description:
Workspace enables the Reject voice call operation in SIP Server environments that use multi-site routing.
The reject route mechanism has been extended to accommodate different types of 'reject' implementations, depending on the context. Use the interaction.reject-route to enable the reject route mechanism by specifying a string as a key to be used at run-time to retrieve the behavior description from the interaction user data. It is the responsibility of the administrator to define the multi-site reject criteria.
The reject route is specified in the interaction user-data in the following format: <reject-method>:<dn>@<switch>. Prior to 8.1.3 version, the format was defined by <dn>@<switch> only. The <reject-method> attribute is optional to maintain backward-compatibility with pre-8.1.3 configurations. When <reject-method> is specified, ensure that the following characters are also specified: ':', '@', and the <switch> field. The following are the possible values for the <reject-method> attribute:
  • pullback: Reject applies the following action: SingleStepTransfer(OtherDN='',Location=<switch>,extensions contains *pullback*). This is the legacy behavior for multi-site reject. This approach works only when the value of the TServer/divert-on-ringing SIP Server configuration option is set to true.
  • sst: Reject applies the following action: SingleStepTransfer(OtherDN=<dn>,Location=<switch>). Warning, if the value of dn@switch corresponds to the same routing point as the one that is handling the call that is being delivered to the agent, the action will succeed only if the value of the TServer/divert-on-ringing SIP Server configuration option is set to true.
  • release: Reject applies releaseCall. This value must be applied when the value of the TServer/divert-on-ringing SIP Server option is set to false.
parameter.valid-description: A string that represents an attached data key.

parameter.name: interaction.unconditional-force-close
parameter.description: Specifies whether the contextual menu 'Force Close This Case' is always enabled ('true') or conditioned to the detection of evidence that current interactions can no longer be closed using regular functional user operations.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.window.popup-topmost-z-order
parameter.description: Specifies whether the interaction window can "steal" focus from other active applications when auto-answer is enabled.
