When set to 'false', the Interaction Window tries to gracefully get the focus; however, due to certain Windows Operating System settings, this attempt might not result in moving the interaction window to the front.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: At the next interaction if the value is changed to 'true', or when the application is started or restarted if the value is changed to 'false'.

parameter.name: interaction.window.show-case-interaction-panel-button
parameter.displayName: Interaction - Show Interaction Window Left Panel Collapse Control
parameter.description: Specifies whether the collapse/expand button on interaction windows is enabled. If the value of this option is set to true, the button is enabled, and agents can collapse and expand the interaction view (left panel). The interaction view contains the controls and content of the interaction. If this view is collapsed, only the right panel is displayed. This is typically the Contact Information and Contact History view or Standard Responses view or any available customized view. If the value of this option is set to false, the button is not enabled, and the interaction view cannot be collapsed.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.window.show-in-taskbar
parameter.description: Indicates whether the interaction window has a task bar button. If not, when minimized the window can be restored from the Interaction Bar.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: interaction.window-title
parameter.description: Defines the title of the interaction window that appears in the Windows Task Bar by specifying a string that contains the following field codes:$Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$Contact.FirstName$,$Contact.LastName$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Interaction.Type$.This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: $Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$Contact.FirstName$,$Contact.LastName$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Interaction.Type$
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.allows-floating-transparency
parameter.description: Specifies whether the floating interaction window is created with a ‘transparent’ style. Setting this option to ‘false’ is required in some video hardware environment in order to get a proper rendering of Team Communicator control when it is displayed from the floating interaction window, typically to select an e-mail address. The ‘false’ value is coming with a slight degradation of the appearance of the floating window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.detail-tooltip.max-height
parameter.displayName: Interaction Bar - Detail Tooltip Max Height
parameter.description: Sets the maximum height, in pixels, of the tooltip for interaction details of Interaction Bar items. The tooltip can contain the chat transcript, the body of an e-mail and so on.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value greater than or equal to 0.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.enable-quick-access
parameter.description:
When this option is set to true interactions handled by the agent are presented as extensions of the main window in a floating mode and/or a pinned mode (see also option interaction-bar.quick-access-modes).
This option requieres the privilege InteractionWorkspace.InteractionBar.canUse. When set to false, the legacy window presentation is used.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.quick-access-auto-open
parameter.displayName: Interaction Bar - Quick Acces Auto Open
parameter.description: Specifies whether the interaction body should be collapsed or opened automatically when it is added to the interaction bar (when incoming interaction is accepted or when it is created for outgoing). This option is not applicable if option interaction-bar.enable-quick-access is set to false.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.quick-access-auto-open.<media-type>
parameter.displayName: Interaction Bar - Quick Acces Auto Open
parameter.description: Specifies whether the interaction body of a particular media type should be collapsed or opened automatically when it is added to the interaction bar (when incoming interaction is accepted or when it is created for outgoing). This option is not applicable if option interaction-bar.enable-quick-access is set to false. When it is defined for a media type this option overwrites the definition of generic option "interaction-bar.quick-access-auto-open".
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.quick-access-modes
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of modes that are available when interactions are displayed in 'quick access' mode. The available modes are:
  • Pinned: the interaction view occupies the full available size, shared with Supporting Views like 'Contact' and 'My Channels'.
  • Floating: the interaction view is presented in a floating window that is painted above any other kind of content and that fits the visual material to display. This view cannot display content displayed on the right part like Contact Profile or Responses.
When more than one mode is specified, the end user can switch from one to the other using a dedicated control. This option is not applicable if option interaction-bar.enable-quick-access is set to false. For a given media type this option can be overridden by option interaction-bar.quick-access-modes.<media-type>.

parameter.name: interaction-bar.quick-access-modes.<media-type>
parameter.description:
Use this option as a template to specify the list of modes available when presenting interactions of the given media type in 'quick access' mode. The available modes are:
  • Pinned: the interaction view occupies the full available size, shared with Supporting Views like 'Contact' and 'My Channels'.
  • Floating: the interaction view is presented in a floating window that is painted above any other kind of content and that fits the visual material to display. This view cannot display content displayed on the right part like Contact Profile or Responses.
When more than one mode is specified, the end user can switch from one to the other using a dedicated control. When it is defined for a media type this option overwrites the definition of generic option 'interaction-bar.quick-access-modes'. This option is not applicable if option interaction-bar.enable-quick-access is set to false.

parameter.name: interaction-management.available-interaction-page-sizes
parameter.displayName: Interaction Management - Available Content Page Sizes
parameter.description: The possible values for the number of rows per page in the Interaction Management content view. Values grater than 100 are not recommended due to performance impact. The maximum value depends on the content of interactions and the robustness of your network. If you specify a value that is too high, the request to get a snapshot will fail and an error message is displayed.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of numbers that define the number of rows per result page from which the agent can make selections.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-management.filters
parameter.description: Defines the filters that are displayed to the supervisor for interaction management. The filter names refer to the names of the Application Option sections that are defining the Filters.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Filter names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interaction-management.interactions-filter.displayed-columns
parameter.displayName: Interaction Management - Template For Displayed Columns Configuration of Interaction Queue
parameter.description: The list of interaction fields that are displayed as columns in the Interaction Queue view.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of interaction data keys, for example: From,Subject,Received
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: interactions.window.allows-transparency-on-winos6
parameter.description: Specifies whether the interaction window is presented in transparent style on Windows OS version 6 or higher. Unmanaged controls, such as web browsers, are not able to function in Windows Vista and Windows 7 if non-transparent windows are used. Set the value to false to permit the display of unmanaged controls.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: intercommunication.<media-type>.queue
parameter.description: Use this option as a template for any specific workitem media-type to specify the name of the Interaction Queue that is used by the 'routing based' feature for the specified workitem media-type. The following attached data are added by Interaction Worskpace: IW_RoutingBasedOriginalEmployeeId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetType,IW_RoutingBasedRequestType.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Queue

parameter.name: intercommunication.<media-type>.routing-based-actions
parameter.description: Use this option as a template for any specific workitem media type to define the list of 'routing based' actions that an agent is allowed to perform for the specified workitem media-type.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid operation names from the following list: OneStepTransfer.

parameter.name: intercommunication.<media-type>.routing-based-targets
parameter.description: Use this option as a template for any specific workitem media type to define the list of targets that are contacted through the 'routing based' mechanism for the requests that are defined in the option 'intercommunication.<media-type>.routing-based-actions'. Note: The targets 'AgentGroup' and 'Skill' are always addressed through routing; therefore, they are not affected by this option.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: Agent, InteractionQueue

parameter.name: intercommunication.chat.conference.invite-timeout
parameter.description: Specifies the time-out interval for a chat conference or chat consultation invitation to a skill, agent group, or interaction queue.
parameter.valid-description: from 30 to MAXINT

parameter.name: intercommunication.chat.queue
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the Interaction Queue that is used by the 'routing based' feature for Chat. The following attached data are added by Interaction Worskpace: IW_RoutingBasedOriginalEmployeeId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetType,IW_RoutingBasedRequestType.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Queue

parameter.name: intercommunication.chat.routing-based-actions
parameter.description: Specifies the list of 'routing based' actions that an agent is allowed to perform.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid operation names from the following list: OneStepTransfer.

parameter.name: intercommunication.chat.routing-based-targets
parameter.description: Defines the list of targets that are contacted through the 'routing based' mechanism for the requests that are defined in the option 'intercommunication.chat.routing-based-actions'. Note: The targets 'AgentGroup' and 'Skill' are always addressed through routing; therefore, they are not affected by this option.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: Agent, InteractionQueue

parameter.name: intercommunication.email.queue
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the Interaction Queue that is used by the 'routing based' feature for E-Mail. The following attached data are added by Interaction Worskpace: IW_RoutingBasedOriginalEmployeeId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetType,IW_RoutingBasedRequestType.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Queue

parameter.name: intercommunication.email.routing-based-actions
parameter.description: Specifies the list of 'routing based' actions that an agent is allowed perform.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid operation names from the following list: OneStepTransfer.

parameter.name: intercommunication.email.routing-based-targets
parameter.description: Specifies the list of targets that are contacted through the 'routing based' mechanism for the requests that are defined in the option 'intercommunication.email.routing-based-actions'. Note: The targets 'AgentGroup' and 'Skill' are always addressed through routing; therefore, they are not affected by this option.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: Agent, InteractionQueue

parameter.name: intercommunication.im.routing-based-actions
parameter.description: Defines the list of Routing Based actions.
parameter.valid-description: Comma separated list of valid operation names from the following: MakeIM
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: intercommunication.im.routing-based-targets
parameter.description: Defines the list of targets that are contacted through the 'routing based' mechanism for requests that are defined by the following option: 'intercommunication.voice.routing-based-actions'. Note: The targets 'AgentGroup' and 'Skill' are always addressed through routing; therefore, these are not considered by this option.
parameter.valid-description: Comma separated list of valid object types from the following: Agent, ACDQueue, RoutingPoint

parameter.name: intercommunication.im.routing-points
parameter.description: Determines the call number that is used by the Routing Base feature. The following attached data are added by Interaction Worskpace: IW_RoutingBasedOriginalEmployeeId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetType, IW_RoutingBasedRequestType, IW_RoutingBasedLocation.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of call number names in the following format: $dn_name@switch$

parameter.name: intercommunication.sms.queue
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the Interaction Queue that is used by the 'routing based' feature for SMS. The following attached data are added by Interaction Worskpace: IW_RoutingBasedOriginalEmployeeId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetType,IW_RoutingBasedRequestType.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Queue

parameter.name: intercommunication.sms.routing-based-actions
parameter.description: Defines the list of 'routing based' actions that an agent is allowed to perform.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid operation names from the following list: OneStepTransfer.

parameter.name: intercommunication.sms.routing-based-targets
parameter.description: Defines the list of targets that are contacted through the 'routing based' mechanism for the requests that are defined in the option 'intercommunication.sms.routing-based-actions'. Note: The targets 'AgentGroup' and 'Skill' are always addressed through routing; therefore, they are not affected by this option.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: Agent, InteractionQueue

parameter.name: intercommunication.voice.routing-based-actions
parameter.description: Defines the list of Routing Based Actions that an agent may perform.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid operation names from the following list: MakeCall, OneStepTransfer, InitTransfer, InitConference, OneStepConference.

parameter.name: intercommunication.voice.routing-based-targets
parameter.description: Defines the list of targets that are contacted through the 'routing based' mechanism for the requests that are defined in the option 'intercommunication.voice.routing-based-actions'. Note: The targets 'AgentGroup' and 'Skill' are always addressed through routing; therefore, they are not affected by this option.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: Agent, ACDQueue, RoutingPoint, Contact, TypeDestination.

parameter.name: intercommunication.voice.routing-points
parameter.description: Determines the call number that is used by the Routing Base feature. The following attached data are added by Interaction Worskpace: IW_RoutingBasedOriginalEmployeeId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetId,IW_RoutingBasedTargetType,IW_RoutingBasedRequestType, IW_RoutingBasedLocation.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of call number names in the following format: $dn_name@switch$

parameter.name: intercommunication.voicemail.enabled-target-types
parameter.description: Specifies the types of targets to which it is possible to deposit a voicemail or transfer a call.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: Agent, AgentGroup

parameter.name: intercommunication.voicemail.routing-points
parameter.description: Specifies the routing point to be used to deposit a voicemail or transfer a call to an agent or an agent group mailbox.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of routing point names in the following format: $dn_name@switch$

parameter.name: keyboard.hotkey.agent-not-ready
parameter.description: The combination of keys that can be used as a Window Hotkey to set the agent Not Ready.
parameter.valid-description: Only the name of a key or a key combination the begins with one of the following modifier key names: Ctrl, Shift, Alt, and Win, and ends with a character key. Separate the modifier key name from the character key with the '+' character.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: keyboard.hotkey.agent-not-ready-with-reason.<action-code>
parameter.displayName: Hotkey - Template For Declaration Of Agent Not Ready With Reason Code
parameter.description: This option allows you to associate a combination of keys that can be used as a Window Hotkey to set agent status to a particular Not-Ready Reason Code. You need to use this option as a template and modify its name by replacing the string <action-code> by the 'Code' attribute of the Action Code defined in Management layer. For example if your Action Code name is 'Meeting' and the corresponding code is '1012', you will set the option like this: keyboard.hotkey.agent-not-ready-with-reason.1012=Ctrl+Alt+M.
parameter.valid-description: Only the name of a key or a key combination the begins with one of the following modifier key names: Ctrl, Shift, Alt, and Win, and ends with a character key. Separate the modifier key name from the character key with the '+' character.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: kpi.displayed-kpis
parameter.description: Defines the KPIs that are displayed to the agent. The KPI names refer to the names of the Application Option sections that are defining the KPIs.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of KPI names.

parameter.name: kpi.refresh-time
parameter.description: Defines the frequency of notification (in seconds) for statistics.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value greater than 0.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: kpi.show-agent-groups
parameter.description: Specify if agent group KPI information is displayed to the agent for all groups to which the agent is a member.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: license.lrm-enabled
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Workspace signature is recognized by Genesys License Reporting Manager.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: log.default-filter-type
parameter.description:
Specifies the default view of KVList information (including UserData, Extensions, and Reasons) in the log.
It is applied to the attributes of all KVList pairs except those that are explicitly defined in the log-filter-data key.
parameter.valid-description:
Select a value from the following list:
  • copy
  • skip
  • hide
  • hide-first,<n>
  • unhide-last,<n>
  • unhide-first,<n>
  • unhide-last,<n>
  • custom-filter,<KeyPrefix>,<KeyPost>,<ValuePrefix>,<ValuePost>
The filter 'custom-filter' enables you to define some KeyPrefix, KeyPost, ValuePrefix, ValuePost.
Example: log.default-filter-type: custom-filter,<,>,<#,#>

parameter.name: log.ESDK
parameter.description: Defines the level of logging for API ESDK.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list: All, Debug, Trace, Interaction, Alarm

parameter.name: log.expire
parameter.description: Specifies if log files are stored. If they are stored, specifies the maximum number of files (segments) to be stored before the oldest file is removed. $number$ sets the maximum number of log files to store.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value from 1 through 100.

parameter.name: log.filter-data.<keyName>
parameter.displayName: Log - Template For Specific Filter Type
parameter.description:
Defines the treatment of specific data in the log.
It overrides the general settings specified by the log.default-filter-type option.
parameter.valid-description:
Select a value from the following list:
  • copy
  • skip
  • hide
  • hide-first,<n>
  • unhide-last,<n>
  • unhide-first,<n>
  • unhide-last,<n>
  • custom-filter,<KeyPrefix>,<KeyPost>,<ValuePrefix>,<ValuePost>
The filter 'custom-filter' enables you to define KeyPrefix, KeyPost, ValuePrefix, and ValuePost.
Example: log.filter-data.Subject: custom-filter,>,<,>#,#<

parameter.name: log.max-age
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of days for which Workspace log files are kept. If the option value is greater than 0, the application deletes the old log files (older than the value of this option) at startup. If the option value is set to 0, log files are not deleted at startup.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value from 0 in days

parameter.name: log.PSDK
parameter.description: Define the level of logging for the PSDK API.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list: All, Debug, Trace, Interaction, Standard, Alarm

parameter.name: log.PSDK.SwitchPolicy
parameter.description: Specifies the level of logging for the PSDK SwitchPolicy API.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list: All, Debug, Trace, Interaction, Standard, Alarm

parameter.name: log.segment
parameter.description: If set, specifies that there is a segmentation limit for a log file and defines the limit size in either kilobytes (KB) or megabytes (MB). If the current log segment exceeds the defined size, the file is closed and a new one is created.
parameter.valid-description: $number$ KB or $number$ sets the maximum segment size, in kilobytes. The minimum segment size is 100 KB. $number$ MB sets the maximum segment size, in megabytes.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: log.Trace
parameter.description: Defines the full path of the log file. The file name uses the following extension: ?.%date{yyyyMMdd_HHmmss_fff}.log?. The full path can also contain the following field codes: $Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$Application.Exe$,$Application.ApplicationData$,$Application.RootApplicationData$,$Env.X$ (X: name of environment variable).
parameter.valid-description: A valid Windows file path combined with any supported filed code.

parameter.name: log.verbose
parameter.description: Defines the level of logging. If set to None, the trace is turn off in the Workspace log file. For the other value, if the Workspace log file doesn't exist, it is created by the application.
parameter.valid-description: Select a value from the following list: All, Debug, Trace, Interaction, Standard, Alarm, None

parameter.name: login.<media-type>.auto-not-ready-reason

parameter.description: If the indicated workitem channel is automatically set to NotReady when an agent logs in, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.

parameter.name: login.available-place-groups
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of Place Groups objects agent is allowed to used for login.
If $All$ is configured, all the PlaceGroups objects that are contained in the Agent’s Tenant and on which the Agent has Read Access are available.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of valid Place Group object names or $All$.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.chat.auto-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Login Chat - Auto Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: If the Chat channel is automatically set to NotReady when an agent logs in, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.chat.can-unactivate-channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select and unselect (auto-login or not) the chat channel.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.chat.is-auto-ready
parameter.description: Specifies whether the chat channel is automatically set to the Ready state at login.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.default-place
parameter.description: Specifies the place name or place group that is populated by default during login. This option can use the $Agent.DefaultPlace$ variable. If the agent has a default place that is specified in the agent configuration, then that place is used. However, if no default place exists, then the agent must enter their place in the Place field).
parameter.valid-description: Valid place or place Group
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.email.auto-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Login E-mail - Auto Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: If the E-Mail channel is automatically set to NotReady when an agent logs in, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.email.can-unactivate-channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select and unselect (auto-login or not) the e-mail channel.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.email.is-auto-ready
parameter.description: Specifies whether the e-mail channel is automatically set to the Ready state at login.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.enable-login-without-channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether agents can login to the Workspace application without being logged in to any channels.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.enable-place-completion
parameter.description: This option is used for performance issue at login time (when a lot of agents logs in at the same time). Set this option to false to disable the load of all the places when the Workspace is started. This improves the performance if there are a lot of places in your environment. The restriction with this option set to false is that there is no longer a list of available places in the 2nd login panel.
parameter.valid-description: true or false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.enable-same-agent-place
parameter.description:
Specifies whether the agent can login on the same Place from different workstations.
The value prompt allows the agent to login on the same Place from different workstations, but the agent is first prompted for confirmation before an additional login is permitted.
Notes:
  • This option is applicable when the agent is granted only Voice and/or Instant Messaging channels only. It is not applicable to eServices medias.
  • This option is ignored if the value of the login.enable-check-place-availability option is set to false.
parameter.valid-description: true,false,prompt
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.im.auto-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Login IM - Is Auto Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: If the Instant Messaging channel is automatically set to NotReady when the agent logs in, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.im.available-queues
parameter.description: Enables agents to choose a login queue from a drop-down list or to enter the login queue manually. If this option is empty, agents can type any valid login queue name. If set to "ACDQueue", "RoutingPoint" , "VirtualQueue" or " ACDQueue,RoutingPoint" agents can select one of the defined queues or routing points from a drop-down list.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: ACDQueue, RoutingPoint, VirtualQueue
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.im.can-unactivate-channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select and unselect (activate and deactivate) Instant Messaging channels.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.im.is-auto-ready
parameter.description: In case Instant Messaging channel is automatically set to NotReady at login, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.im.prompt-agent-login-id
parameter.displayName: Login IM - Prompt Agent Login Id
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select a login id from the configured ones for the IM channel in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.im.prompt-dn-password
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent must enter his password for the IM channel in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.im.prompt-queue
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent must enter the ACD Queue for the IM channel in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.place-location-source
parameter.description:
Specifies how Workspace stores the last selected login place in the Windows User Profile when the option 'login.store-recent-place' is set to 'true'. The 'machine-name' and 'vdi' values of this option can be used in hot seating environments (agent not always sitting in front of the same workstation and hard phone) where the Windows User Profile are roaming, i.e. the local preferences saved in one workstation could be restored when same user works with another workstation).
  • standard: The recent place is stored in Windows User Profile without any information about the used workstation. This is the legacy recent place storage model.
  • machine-name: The recent place is stored along with the name of the machine where Workspace executable is actually running. This model is appropriate when Workspace is installed on the physical workstation where the agent is logging in using windows roaming profile.
  • vdi: The recent place is stored along with the name of the physical machine from which the agent is executing his virtual session (Citrix XenApp/XenDesktop, VMWare Horizon, Windows Terminal Server) This model is appropriate when Workspace is installed in a Virtual Desktop Environment and does not run on the physical workstation where the agent is logging in. In case the logic to capture the machine name running the VDI client does not return anything, for example because user is executing Workspace on a physical workstation, this mode falls back to 'machine-name' mode.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: standard,machine-name,vdi
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.place-selection-type
parameter.description: Specifies the types of object that can be used to fill place selection. About PlaceGroup, see reference login.available-place-groups.
parameter.valid-description: Comma separated list of types from the following list: Place, PlaceGroup.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.place-state-timeout
parameter.description: Specifies how long Workspace should wait for information about the state of a Place when checking Place availability at login time.
parameter.valid-description: Any positive integer.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.prompt-place
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent must enter his place in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.sip-cluster.phone-number
parameter.description: Specifies the device number that is used to log an agent to the SIP Cluster. This option can use the $Agent.EmployeeId$ variable. If the value of the option is empty, the agent must enter her or his phone number for the voice channel in the Login view.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid device number or a string that contains one of the following field codes: $Agent.EmployeeId$.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.sip-cluster.store-recent-phone-number
parameter.displayName: Login - SIP Cluster Store Recent Phone Number
parameter.description:
Specifies whether the phone number that was typed during the most recent login to SIP Cluster infrastructure is stored in the user profile so that it can be restored during the next login.
This option is available if the login.sip-cluster.phone-number option is empty.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.sms.auto-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Login SMS - Auto Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: If the SMS channel is automatically set to NotReady when an agent logs in, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.sms.can-unactivate-channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select and unselect (activate and deactivate) the SMS channel.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.sms.is-auto-ready
parameter.description: Specifies whether the SMS channel is automatically in the ready state at agent login.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.store-recent-place
parameter.description: Specifies whether the most recently used Place is stored. This option is available if the login.default-place option is not set to $Agent.DefaultPlace$.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.store-username
parameter.description: Specifies whether the most recently used username is stored in local user profile. If the value is set to false, the username will not be populated by default in the login screen when application is restarted.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.voice.auto-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Login Voice - Is Auto Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: If the Voice channel is automatically set to NotReady when the agent logs in, this option defines the NotReady Reason code.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.voice.available-queues
parameter.description: Enables agents to choose a login queue from a drop-down list or to enter the login queue manually. If this option is empty, agents can type any valid login queue name. If set to "ACDQueue", "RoutingPoint" , "VirtualQueue" or " ACDQueue,RoutingPoint" agents can select one of the defined queues or routing points from a drop-down list.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid object types from the following list: ACDQueue, RoutingPoint, VirtualQueue
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.voice.can-unactivate-channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select and unselect (activate and deactivate) voice channels.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.voice.force-relogin

parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.voice.is-auto-ready
parameter.description: Specifies whether the voice channels are in the Ready state at login.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.voice.prompt-agent-login-id
parameter.displayName: Login Voice - Prompt Agent Login Id
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select a login id from the configured ones for the voice channel in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: login.voice.prompt-dn-less-phone-number
parameter.displayName: Login - Prompt DN Less Phone Number
parameter.description: Specifies whether a DN-less phone number is prompted for in the login window. This option could be defined in PlaceGroup Object. This option is specific to SIP Server environment.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.voice.prompt-dn-password
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent must enter his password for the voice channel in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.voice.prompt-queue
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent must enter the ACD Queue for the voice channel in the login window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.voice.restore-dn-less-phone-number-on-logout
parameter.displayName: Login - Restore DN Less Phone Number On Logout
parameter.description: Specifies whether the DN-less phone number stored in the agent's DN is restored to its original value when the agent logs out of this DN. This option is applicable only when the option login.voice.prompt-dn-less-phone-number is set to true. This option is specific to SIP Server environment.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.voice.use-dn-less-login-extension
parameter.displayName: Login - Use DN Less Login Extension
parameter.description:
Specifies how the DN-less phone number provided by an agent during login is propagated to the Genesys back-end:
  • false: The phone number is stored in the agent's DN annex in Configuration Server (default)
  • true: The phone number is passed as an extension through the agent's login request to SIP Server (SIP Server 8.1.102.93 or higher is required)
parameter.valid-description: true,false

parameter.name: login.webcallback.auto-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Login Web Callback - Auto Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: Specifies the Not Ready Reason that is displayed after an agent logs in on a channel that is not automatically set to Ready. The Not Ready Reason corresponds to the name of a Not Ready Action Code. If the reason is empty, no Not Ready Reason is displayed for the channel at log in time if the channel is in the Not Ready state. This option is ignored if the option login.webcallback.is-auto-ready is set to 'true'.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: login.webcallback.can-unactivate-channel
parameter.displayName: Login - Can Deactivate Web Callback Channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent can select and unselect (auto-login or not) the Web Callback channel.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.webcallback.is-auto-ready
parameter.displayName: Login Web Callback - Is Auto Ready
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Web Callback channel is automatically set to the Ready state at login.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: login.workmode
parameter.description: Specifies the workmode that is applied when the voice DN logs in. If set to 'auto-in', the agent is automatically in Ready state. If set to 'manual-in', the agent must manually activate the Ready state. To determine whether your switch supports the workmode, refer to the Deployment Guide of the relevant T-Server.
parameter.valid-description: unknown, auto-in, manual-in
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted or if the agent changes place.

parameter.name: logout.enable-exit-on-logoff-error
parameter.displayName: Logout - Enable Exit On Log Off Error
parameter.description:
Specifies whether the agent can log out from the application even if one of the voice channel log offs resulted in an error.
The value prompt allows the agent to log out of the application if a log off channel error occurs. The agent is first prompted for confirmation before logging out the application.
parameter.valid-description: true,false,prompt
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: logout.voice.use-login-queue-on-logout
parameter.displayName: Voice - Use Login Queue On Logout
parameter.description:
(For Alcatel 4400/OXE switch only) Specifies whether or not the queue that is used on login should be used for the queue on logout.
  • If this option is set to true, Supervisors must refine their Place/Channel information to 'None' before selecting Exit.
  • If this option is set to false, Supervisors are not required to refine their Place/Channel information to log out correctly.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: main-window.auto-hide-display-delay
parameter.displayName: Main Window Auto Hide Display Delay
parameter.description: This option specifies the duration, in milliseconds, for which the Main Window remains hidden before being displayed when the mouse is at the top of the screen. The value 0 means specifies the minimum value.
parameter.valid-description: 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: main-window.bypass-auto-hide-conditions
parameter.displayName: Main Window - Bypass Auto Hide Conditions
parameter.description: In environments where an agent is granted the privilege to “auto hide” the main window, this option can be set to ‘true’ when it is necessary to bypass the default control that disables the Workspace “auto hide” function when a third party “auto hide” window is reported as already present by Windows system. This can be useful in Citrix XenApp environment where Workspace is running as a Seamless window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: main-window.window-title
parameter.description: Defines the title of the Main Window that appears in the Windows Task Bar by specifying a string that contains the following field codes:$Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$, $Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: $Window.Title$.
parameter.valid-description: $Window.Title$,$Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$.

parameter.name: openmedia.bundle.sms
parameter.description: Defines the list of media types that are used to implement the SMS channel. This list can contain 'sms' (SMS Page mode) and/or smssession (SMS Session Mode) and/or mms (MMS Page Mode)
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid media type names
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: openmedia.workitem-channels
parameter.description: Specifies the list of Workitem channels that are used by the agent.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid Media Types.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: options.clean-up-former-record-location
parameter.description: Specifies whether the configuration should be cleaned-up from former record location.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: options.record-location
parameter.description: In environment where option 'options.record-option-locally-only' is set to 'false', this option specifies the place where the user preferences are supposed to be stored when agent exits from the application. If this option is left empty the user preferences are stored in Person's Annex in Configuration Server. The full path can also contain the following field codes: $Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$Env.X$ (where X is the name of the environment variable). Whatever the path definition is an information identifying the user (Username) is appended to the specified path.
parameter.valid-description: A valid file path that can be a a UNC (\\host\directory\...)
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: options.record-option-locally-only
parameter.displayName: Options - Record All Options In Local File Only
parameter.description: Specifies whether the display settings for the agent are stored locally or in the agent annex.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: outbound.callback-types
parameter.description: Specifies the list of callback types from which an agent can select when rescheduling an outbound record. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: Select at least one item from the list

parameter.name: outbound.call-result-automatically-selected
parameter.description: Specifies the call result to be selected by default for outbound records. The specified call result must be defined by the values that are specified for the 'outbound.call-result-values' option. If set to an empty value, the current call result of the outbound record is selected, or 'unknown' is selected if there is no current value.
parameter.valid-description: Select one value from the list.

parameter.name: outbound.call-result-is-mandatory
parameter.description: Specifies whether it is mandatory for agents to set a Call Result before Marking Done an Outbound interaction. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: outbound.call-result-values
parameter.description: The list of call results that are available for the agent to use for outbound interaction. The call results are displayed in the order in which they appear in the list.
parameter.valid-description: Select at least one item from the list.

parameter.name: outbound.campaign-stale-timeout
parameter.description: Records remain editable for a specified period of time after a campaign is unloaded, to reflect the Outbound Contact Server (OCS) <tt>OCServer</tt> section <tt>stale_clean_timeout</tt> option. A value of <tt>0</tt> means that the outbound record becomes read-only when the campaign is unloaded. A positive value is the duration, in minutes, during which the outbound record remains editable. During this period, the agent sees the campaign as Active. The campaign is removed from the campaigns list after this period. A value of <tt>-1</tt> means that the outbound record is always editable (however, this action may fail in the OCS).
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value

parameter.name: outbound.complete-record-before-transfer
parameter.description:
Specifies whether an agent transferring an Outbound call to an agent who is not allowed to handle Outbound interactions must mark the call as Done before completing the transfer.
If the value is set to false, the transferring agent can edit the outbound record after the transfer of call is done; Workspace attempts to update the record in OCS accordingly; However, the update operation can fail, depending on topology. If the target agent is part of the campaign, he or she can edit the record. This is the legacy behavior.
If the value is set to true, the Outbound enabled agent must edit and mark Done the record before transferring the call. Workspace updates and closes the record in OCS before validating the call transfer; the target agent receives a read-only record.
parameter.valid-description: true,false

parameter.name: outbound.fields.float-separator-in-db
parameter.description: Specifies the separator that is used for floating point numbers in the database for outbound fields. This option should be used when the decimal symbol in the regional settings of the agent workstation is different from the one provided by the database.
parameter.valid-description: A valid float separator. Typical float separators are: '.',',','\'

parameter.name: outbound.load-at-startup
parameter.displayName: Outbound - Load Calling Lists At Startup
parameter.description: When this option is set to true the metadata of all the Outbound Calling Lists visible to the logged in agent is loaded and cached at login time. When this option is set to 'false' the metadata of the Outbound Calling Lists assigned to a specific Campaign is loaded on demand when the agent is notified by Outbound Server that he is engaged in this Outbound Campaign. When set to 'false' this option decreases the login time in environments where many Calling Lists are configured.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: outbound.push-preview.auto-answer
parameter.displayName: Outbound - Auto Accept Incoming Push Preview Interaction
parameter.description: Specifies whether a push preview outbound interaction is automatically accepted when Interaction Server Invite event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: outbound.push-preview.media-types
parameter.description: The list of media types that are available for the agent to use for outbound push-preview interactions.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: outbound.push-preview.use-combined-channel
parameter.displayName: Outbound - Push Preview Use Combined Channel
parameter.description: Specifies whether the outboundpreview channel is combined with the voice channel in the User Interface. If set to 'true', only the voice channel is presented, and any change in the status of one channel is applied to the other channel
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: outbound.record-information.frame-color
parameter.description: Specifies the background color the Record Information view header of Outbound interactions. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: outbound.record-information.header-foreground-color
parameter.displayName: Outbound - Call Information Header Text Color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the Record Information view header of Outbound interactions. Example #FFFFFFFF for white color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: outbound.reschedule-inherit-parent-availability-interval
parameter.displayName: Outbound - Reschedule Inherit Parent Availability Interval
parameter.description: Specifies how Workspace populates the default values of the availability ("from"-"till") interval for a new outbound record created when rescheduling to a new number. False means that the default values are retrieved from the "Till" and "From" Field object of the Configuration, "true" means that the "Till" and "From" are inherited from the parent record.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: outbound.sound.campaign-updated
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound-configuration string when the campaign status is updated. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: when the interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: outbound.timed-preview-auto-dial
parameter.description: Specifies the time in seconds after which the Outbound Preview Phone Number is automatically dialed when an Interaction Outbound Preview is accepted. A value of <tt>-1</tt> means that there is no automatic dial, the dial is manual only. A value of <tt>0</tt> means an immediate automatic dial. Notes: the option applies equally to 'push preview', 'pull preview', and 'reschedule preview' contexts. In This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: any integer greater or equal to -1

parameter.name: outbound.treatment-mode
parameter.description: Specifies the type of treatment to be applied for the outbound record after it is marked as processed. If set to none, no treatment is applied for the outbound record.
parameter.valid-description:
Select one value from the following list: personal,campaign,none.
none: The application never applies any treatment to mark processed requests.
campaign: The treatment RecordTreatCampaign is applied to the record when a mark processed action is executed.
personal: The treatment RecordTreatPersonal is applied to the record when a mark processed action is executed.

Note: campaign and personal are valid unless a call has been rescheduled by the agent.

parameter.name: outbound-callback.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the sound-configuration string of a scheduled callback pushed to the agent as a preview. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: when the interaction notification is closed).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: presence.evaluate-presence
parameter.description: Specify whether to evaluate presence or not. Set this option to true if the presence must be evaluated for agents, agent groups, T-Server queues, routing points, and interation queues.
parameter.valid-description: true or false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: printing.use-print-preview
parameter.description: Specifies whether a print preview is shown when the user request to print a document.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: reporting.case.report-case-in-focus-duration
parameter.description: Specifies wether the time that an interaction has been in the focus of the agent during its handling is reported to T-Server or Interaction Server at the end of its processing by the agent. When it is enabled, this notification allows Genesys Interaction Concentrator and Genesys Infomart to calculate some focus time metrics.
parameter.valid-description: true,false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: reporting.include-acw-time
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Workspace should include ACW to 'In focus time.
parameter.valid-description: true,false

parameter.name: screen-recording.client.address
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording - Screen Recording Client Communication Address
parameter.description: Specifies the IP address or host of Screen Recording Service. When left empty, the connection to the Screen Recording Service is established on localhost according the IP version specified at the system level.
parameter.valid-description: A valid IP address or host.

parameter.name: screen-recording.client.max-attempts
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording – Screen Recording Client Max Connection Attempts
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of attempts to establish communication with Screen Recording Client at Workspace initialization time before considering the Screen Recording Client inactive.
parameter.valid-description: An integer greater than 0.

parameter.name: screen-recording.client.ping-interval
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording – Screen Recording Client Keep-alive Interval
parameter.description: Specifies the interval in milliseconds between two keep-alive requests to Screen Recording Client.
parameter.valid-description: An integer greater than 0.

parameter.name: screen-recording.client.port
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording – Screen Recording Client Communication Port
parameter.description: Specifies the port on which Screen Recording Client listens for credentials."
parameter.valid-description: A valid TCP/IP port number.

parameter.name: screen-recording.client.secure-connection
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording – Screen Recording Client Secure Connection
parameter.description: Specifies whether secure connection should be used for the communication between Workspace and Screen Recording Client.
parameter.valid-description: true, false.

parameter.name: screen-recording.htcc.peer_uri
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording – Recording Web Services Peer URI
parameter.description: Specifies the URI representing the HTTP/HTTPS access to the Genesys Interaction Recording Web Services (or Genesys Web Services for older versions of the Genesys Interaction Recording solutions) of the peer site in a Disaster Recovery deployment. For example: http://server.domain:8081.
parameter.valid-description: A valid HTTP/HTTPS URI.

parameter.name: screen-recording.htcc.uri
parameter.displayName: Screen Recording – Recording Web Services URI
parameter.description: Specifies the URI representing the HTTP/HTTPS access to Genesys Interaction Recording Web Services (or Genesys Web Services for older versions of the Genesys Interaction Recording solutions). For example: http://server.domain:8081.
parameter.valid-description: A valid HTTP/HTTPS URI.

parameter.name: security.disable-rbac
parameter.displayName: Security - Disable Role Based Access Control
parameter.description: Disables role based access (RBAC). If this option is set to true, all the Workspace tasks are available to the agents. If this option is set to false, the list of agent tasks must be defined in Genesys Administrator.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: security.enable-debug-information
parameter.displayName: Security - Enable To Display Debug Part In About Window
parameter.description: Specifies if the agent is able to display the Debug part (with buttons 'Exe','Logs','GC',...) in the about window.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: security.inactivity-force-not-ready-state
parameter.displayName: Security - Force Not Ready Reason On Inactivity Timeout
parameter.description: Specifies whether the channels already in 'Not Ready' status (with or without a reason) are switched to the reason specified in option security.inactivity-not-ready-reason when the agent is set to 'Not Ready' per the condition defined by the option 'security.inactivity-set-agent-not-ready'. If this option is set to false, only the status of the 'Ready' and 'After Call Work' channels are updated.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: security.inactivity-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Security - Not Ready Reason On Inactivity Timeout
parameter.description: Specify the not-ready reason if the status of an agent is automatically set to not-ready following agent inactivity detection.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: security.inactivity-set-agent-not-ready
parameter.displayName: Security - Not Ready On Inactivity Timeout
parameter.description: Specifies if the agent status is automatically set to not-ready when agent inactivity is detected.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: security.inactivity-timeout
parameter.description: Specifies the agent-inactivity timeout interval, in minutes. If the agent has been inactive (not using the mouse or keyboard) for longer than the inactivity timeout interval, the agent must reauthenticate to be able to use the Workspace application.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value. If set to 0, inactivity is not taken into account.

parameter.name: security.session-lock-force-not-ready-state
parameter.displayName: Security - Session Lock Force Not Ready State
parameter.description: Specifies whether the channels already in 'Not Ready' status (with or without a reason) are switched to the reason specified in option security.session-lock-not-ready-reason when the agent is set to 'Not Ready' per the condition defined by the option 'security.session-lock-set-agent-not-ready'. If this option is set to false, only the status of the 'Ready' and 'After Call Work' channels are updated.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: security.session-lock-not-ready-reason
parameter.displayName: Security - Session Lock Not Ready Reason
parameter.description: When the option 'agent-status.not-ready-on-session-lock.is-enabled' is set to 'true', specifies the 'Not Ready' reason used when forcing the applicable channel to 'Not Ready'.
parameter.valid-description: A valid not ready reason
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: security.session-lock-set-agent-not-ready
parameter.displayName: Security - Session Lock Set Agent Not Ready
parameter.description: Specifies whether the agent status is switched to 'Not Ready' automatically when the Windows session is locked while the agent state is 'Ready'.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sip-cluster.data-center-locations
parameter.description: Specifies the list of data center locations that are available for SIP Clustering.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sip-cluster.reconnect-timeout
parameter.description: In SIP Cluster environment, specifies the duration, in seconds, between each attempt to reconnect to SIP Server (TController) and/or Stat Server in the case of a connection loss.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: sipendpoint.core-deadlock-detection-delay
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Core Deadlock Detection Delay
parameter.description: Specifies the time, in milliseconds, that Workspace SIP Endpoint waits before considering itself deadlocked. When deadlock is detected, Workspace SIP Endpoint automatically restarts. Genesys recommends that you specify a value greater than 12500 ms.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.enable-ipv6
parameter.description: This option allows to override the environment variable GCTI_CONN_IPV6_ON connections to SIP server and RTP. The value 'auto' indicates that option inherits from environment variable GCTI_CONN_IPV6_ON. If the variable doesn't exist, the option is 'false'.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: auto, false, true.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.ip-version
parameter.description: This option allows to define Internet Protocol Version of SIP server and RTP type connection. The value auto indicates that Internet Protocol Version inherits of environment variable GCTI_CONN_IP_VERSION. If the variable doesn't exist, the option is '4,6'.
parameter.valid-description: A value from the following list: auto, 4,6, 6,4.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.certificate-search-value
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint Certificate Search Value
parameter.description:
Specifies a string value Workspace use to select a certificate. This option is used only if sipendpoint.standalone.protocol option is 'https'. This is for Workspace SIP Endpoint only. The search order with this value is:
  • First: The certificate thumbprint if sipendpoint.standalone.security-level is set to 2 or 3.
  • Second: The certificate subject with this value if sipendpoint.standalone.security-level is set to 2 or 3.
  • Third: The certificate subject with agent configured email address if sipendpoint.standalone.security-level is set to 2 or 3.
  • Fourth: The certificate issuer with this value if sipendpoint.standalone.security-level is set to 2.
parameter.valid-description: A string containing the search value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.port
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint HTTP Service Port
parameter.description: Specifies the port number of the HTTP connector of the SIP Endpoint (Workspace SIP Endpoint or Genesys Softphone) where Workspace will connect.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.protocol
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint Protocol
parameter.description:
Specifies the connection protocol used to communicate between Workspace and the SIP Endpoint (Workspace SIP Endpoint or Genesys Softphone).
  • "": Named pipes (Workspace SIP Endpoint only)
  • "http": HTTP protocol with SIP Endpoint in standalone mode (Workspace SIP Endpoint or Genesys Softphone)
  • "https": HTTP secure protocol with SIP Endpoint in standalone mode (Workspace SIP Endpoint or Genesys Softphone)
parameter.valid-description: http, https
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.security-level
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint HTTP Security Level
parameter.description:
Specifies the Workspace security level for http/https connection. This option is used only if sipendpoint.standalone.protocol option is not empty. This is for Workspace SIP Endpoint only.
  • 0: Valid for HTTP or HTTPS connection without Workspace certificate and no control on SIP Endpoint certificate.
  • 1: Valid for HTTPS connection without Workspace certificate and SIP Endpoint certificate validation.
  • 2: Valid for HTTPS connection with Workspace corportate certificate and SIP Endpoint certificate validation
  • 3: Valid for HTTPS connection with Workspace personal certificate and SIP Endpoint certificate and certificate subject validation
parameter.valid-description: One value from the list: 0, 1, 2, 3
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.subject-criteria
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint Certificate Subject Criteria
parameter.description: Specifies a string that gives a list of subject fields to validate in the server certificate. This option is used only if sipendpoint.standalone.protocol option is 'https' and the sipendpoint.standalone.security-level option is 3. This is for Workspace SIP Endpoint only.
parameter.valid-description: A string listing the fields to validate in the subject (as: "E,CN,OU,OU,OU,DC,DC,DC,DC").

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.subject-matching-properties
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint Certificate Subject Matching Properties
parameter.description: Specifies a string that gives a list of current user property values to match with the list of criteria defined by sipendpoint.standalone.subject-criteria option. The certificate subject validation process compare the subject criteria values with current user property values find in its active directory. This option is used only if sipendpoint.standalone.protocol option is 'https' and the sipendpoint.standalone.security-level option is 3. This is for Workspace SIP Endpoint only.
parameter.valid-description: A string listing user properties to match with subject criteria (as: "mail,cn,distinguishedName.OU,distinguishedName.OU,distinguishedName.OU,distinguishedName.DC,distinguishedName.DC,distinguishedName.DC,distinguishedName.DC").

parameter.name: sipendpoint.standalone.vdi-detection-model
parameter.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Standalone SIP Endpoint Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Detection Model
parameter.description:
In a Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI), specifies the type of connectivity between Workspace and the SIP Endpoint (Workspace SIP Endpoint or Genesys Softphone). This option is used only if sipendpoint.standalone.protocol option is not empty.
  • "auto": The SIP Endpoint is running on the workstation. The virtualized Workspace detects automaticaly the VDI type (Workspace SIP Endpoint only)
  • "xenapp": The SIP Endpoint is running on the workstation. The virtualized Workspace is running in Citrix XenApp (Workspace SIP Endpoint only)
  • "xendesktop": The SIP Endpoint is running on the workstation. The virtualized Workspace is running in Citrix XenDesktop (Workspace SIP Endpoint only)
  • "vmware-horizon": The SIP Endpoint is running on the workstation. The virtualized Workspace is running in VMware Horizon (Workspace SIP Endpoint only)
  • "rdp": The SIP Endpoint is running on the workstation. The virtualized Workspace is running in a Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP)-based session (Workspace SIP Endpoint only)
  • "localhost": The SIP Endpoint is running on the VDI server along with the virtualized Workspace (Genesys Softphone only)
parameter.valid-description: One value from the list: auto,xenapp,xendesktop,vmware-horizon,rdp,localhost
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: sms.agent.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the agent in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.agent.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt for the messages entered by the agent in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.agent.text-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the agent in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.auto-answer
parameter.description: Specifies whether a SMS interaction is automatically accepted and joined if necessary when a Interaction Server Invite event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: sms.client.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the client in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.client.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the target client in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.client.text-color
parameter.description: Color of the client text in the SMS view. The HTML format is used to set the value. I.e.: #FFFF0000 for a red color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.default-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which new or reply outbound SMS are submitted when an agent clicks Send and before the interaction is placed in outbound queue.
parameter.valid-description: A valid name of a Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: sms.from-numbers-business-attribute
parameter.description: A character string that specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Attribute Values that are used as 'from numbers' of outbound SMS interactions.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.

parameter.name: sms.max-message-number
parameter.displayName: SMS - Maximum Number Of SMS Per Message
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of SMS allowed per message.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid positive integer. 0 means no maximum.

parameter.name: sms.other-agent.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the other agent in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.other-agent.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the messages entered by the target agent in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.other-agent.text-color
