parameter.description: Color of the other agent text in the SMS view. The HTML format is used to set the value. I.e.: #FFFF0000 for a red color.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.outbound-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which outbound SMS are placed when agents click 'Send' (Page mode only). This options is used only when Interaction Workflow does not set 'Queue for New Interactions' when it is routing Inbound SMS to Agents.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: sms.prompt-for-done
parameter.description: Specifies if the application prompts a confirmation message when a user clicks the 'done' button. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: sms.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the path of the sound file that is played when SMS interaction is ringing. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: sms.subject-max-chars
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters from the SMS message that are used to create the message subject in the contact history if the history doesn't contain subject.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value. If set to 0, no subject.

parameter.name: sms.system.background-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the background of the messages entered by the system in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.system.prompt-color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the prompt of the messages entered by the system in the SMS view.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: sms.time-stamp
parameter.description: Specifies whether the time stamp is displayed in the SMS transcript area.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: sms.transcript-time-frame
parameter.description: Specifies the range of time, in hours, in which to search for previous interactions by the same contact to populate the SMS transcript from the contact history. A value of 0 means nothing is added to the contact history.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value. If set to 0, no historic area .

parameter.name: sounds.preloadfiles
parameter.description:
Specifies the name and location in the application folder of audio files that are to be pre-loaded when an agent logs in. For Example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|primary,Sounds\bell|secondary.mp3,Sounds\chord.mp3|both,Sounds\warning.mp3". The audio files are defined by the options that control sounds, such as voice.ringing-bell and chat.new-message-bell. Files that are not specified by this option are loaded whenever they are needed. The file value has two components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid Windows directory paths and file names. '|' character after the file name must be followed by the output device definition.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted..

parameter.name: spellchecker.chat.prompt-on-send
parameter.description: Specifies whether the user should be prompted of remaining mis-spelled words before sending the chat message.
parameter.valid-description: true, false.

parameter.name: spellchecker.corporate-dictionary
parameter.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of dictionary words that conform to the limitations of allowable characters in the configuration layer. Typically you would use this list to specify common words in your company, such as your company name or product name.
parameter.valid-description: Comma-separated list of words
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: spellchecker.corporate-dictionary-file
parameter.displayName: Spellchecker - Custom Corporate Dictionary File Path
parameter.description: Specifies the name and the path to your corporate dictionary file. The path can be relative to the Workspace working directory (for example: <tt>Dictionaries\CorporateDictionary.txt</tt>) or an absolute path (for example: <tt>C:\PathToDictionaries\CorporateDictionary.txt</tt>). The file must consist of a list of words (one word per line) with ANSI, Unicode, UTF-8 encoding (any encoding accepted by Microsoft .NET).
parameter.valid-description: Absolute or relative path to a text file.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: spellchecker.email.prompt-on-send
parameter.description: Specifies whether the user should be prompted of remaining mis-spelled words before sending the outbound email.
parameter.valid-description: true, false.

parameter.name: spellchecker.im.prompt-on-send
parameter.description: Specifies whether the user should be prompted of remaining mis-spelled words before sending the IM message.
parameter.valid-description: true, false.

parameter.name: spellchecker.sms.prompt-on-send
parameter.description: Specifies whether the user should be prompted of remaining mis-spelled words before sending the SMS message.
parameter.valid-description: true, false.

parameter.name: standard-response.auto-append-star-to-search
parameter.displayName: Standard Response - Auto Append Star To Search
parameter.description: Specifies whether Standard Response searched keywords are automatically appended with a '*' character to obtain a 'starts with' search behavior. When searching in languages such as Chinese or Japanese it is required to set this option to 'false' and setup a CJK Analyzer in Universal Contact Server".
parameter.valid-description: true or false

parameter.name: standard-response.categories
parameter.displayName: Standard Response - Standard Response Library Categories
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of categories that are used to filter the Standard Responses. Agents see only those standard responses that are part of the subtree of those categories.
Each category must be defined using the full access path that must be specified as the root for the agent or agent group to the category;
for example: RootCategory1/CategoryLevel1/CategoryLevel2/CategorySpecifiedAsRoot.
If the option is set to $All$ or left empty, then Standard Responses for all the Category objects defined in the Configuration Layer are displayed.
If an invalid category name is specified in the option, this category is ignored. If all the specified categories are invalid, the option behaves as if it is empty, resulting in the display of all categories.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of category names or full path category starting at the root category. $All$ to display Standard Responses from all categories.

parameter.name: standard-response.default-search-type
parameter.description: Specifies the default search type that is used to search for text in the Standard Response Library. If empty, the default search type is "AnyKeywords".
parameter.valid-description: One of the following values: AnyKeyword, AllKeywords, or ExactText

parameter.name: standard-response.enable-usage-feedback
parameter.displayName: Standard Response - Enable Usage Feedback To Training Server
parameter.description: Specifies whether the usage information of the Standard Response Library is populated in the interaction record in UCS so that it can be read by the Training Server.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: standard-response.field.<FieldCode>
parameter.description: Defines Agent's Custom Field value that can be used in Standard Responses
parameter.valid-description: Any valid string

parameter.name: standard-response.languages
parameter.displayName: Standard Response - Standard Response Library Languages
parameter.description: Specifies the list of languages that are used to filter the Standard Responses. Agents see only those standard responses that are part of the subtree of the root categories of the specified languages.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of languages. $All$ to display Standard Responses from all languages.

parameter.name: standard-response.shortcuts.<keyword>
parameter.displayName: Hotkey - Template For Declaration Of Agent Not Ready With Reason Code
parameter.description: This is a template option that can be cloned to specify the association between a keyword and a standard response defined in eServices Manager or Knowledge Manager. Agent can type the keyword in a text media view and press CTRL+SPACE to get it automatically replaced by the rendered text of the associated Standard Response.
parameter.valid-description: Path to a standard response as defined in Knowlege Manager or eServices Manager.

parameter.name: standard-response.suggested-responses-min-relevancy
parameter.displayName: Standard Response - Suggested Responses Minimum Relevancy Level
parameter.description: Specifies the minimum level of relevancy above which Suggested Responses will be shown from the Standard Response Library.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to 100

parameter.name: statistics.displayed-statistics
parameter.description: Specifies the statistics that are displayed in the Contact Center Statistics tab. The statistics specified by this option match the names of the statistics defined in the options of the Application sections.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Statistic names.

parameter.name: statistics.queues
parameter.description: Specifies the list of queues for which queue statistics are calculated. List of queues can be set through a variable: $AGENT.LOGINQUEUE$ (the queue on which the agent logged in ), $AGENTGROUP.ORIGINATIONDNS$ (the queues set as the origination DNs in the agent groups to which this agent belongs).
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of queue identifiers in the following format: (<queueNumber>@<switchName>)

parameter.name: statistics.refresh-time
parameter.description: Defines the frequency of notification (in seconds) for statistics.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value greater than 0.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistics.routing-points
parameter.displayName: Contact Center Statistics - Routing Points Ids
parameter.description: Specifies the list of routing points for which routing point statistics are calculated.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Routing Point identifiers in the following format: (<routingPointNumber>@<switchName>)

parameter.name: system-tray.tooltip
parameter.description: Defines the tooltip of the Workspace system tray icon by specifying a string that contains the following field codes: $Application.Title$, $Application.Name$, $Agent.UserName$, $Agent.LastName$, $Agent.FirstName$, $Agent.EmployeeId$. If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used:$Application.Title$.
parameter.valid-description: $Application.Title$,$Application.Name$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.add-recent-filters.voice
parameter.description: Specifies whether to store incoming interactions into the "Recent" buffer. By default, the Recent buffer stores only the actions of the agent, such as recent outbound voice calls. If one or more of the valid values is specified, then recent inbound interactions of that type are also stored in the Recent buffer. This enables agents to see a record of missed calls of the specified type(s).
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of interaction types taken from the following values: internal, external, consultation.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.always-clear-textbox-on-new-interaction
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Always Clear Textbox On New Interaction
parameter.description: When this option is set to true, Workspace clears the teamcommunicator search textbox when the interaction is initiated by pressing "Enter" or by clicking on one of the medias of teamcommunicator results. When it is set to false, this option clears the teamcommunicator search textbox only when the interaction is initiated by pressing "Enter"
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.contact-favorite-fields
parameter.description: The list of fields that are displayed to an agent when adding or editing a favorite that is created from a Contact.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of values from the followeing list: CategoryContact, FirstName, LastName, PhoneNumber, EmailAddress.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.corporate-favorites
parameter.description: Specifies the favorites that are pre-assigned to the agents. Those favorites will be 'read only' for the agents.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of favorite names (section names) defined in the Workspace application.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.corporate-favorites-file
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Corporate Favorites File Path
parameter.description: Specifies the name and the path to your corporate favorites definition file. The path can be relative to the Workspace working directory (for example: <tt>Favorites\CorporateFavorites.txt</tt>) or an absolute path (for example: <tt>C:\PathToFavorites\CorporateFavorites.txt</tt>). The file must be in XML format. Overrides the teamcommunicator.corporate-favorites option.
parameter.valid-description: Absolute or relative path to an XML file.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.custom-favorite-fields
parameter.description: The list of fields that are displayed to an agent when adding or editing a favorite created from a typed phone number or e-mail address.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of values from the following list: Category, FirstName, LastName, PhoneNumber, EmailAddress.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.interaction-queue-presence-metrics
parameter.description: Specifies a list of interaction queue presence sections. Each of these sections contain a valid statistic name related to the interaction queue, the text to be displayed in Team Communicator, a warning level value, an error level value, and a list of object ids that apply to this presence statistic.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a comma separated list of interaction queue presence options section names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.internal-favorite-fields
parameter.description: The list of fields that are displayed to an agent when adding or editing a favorite that is created from a named resource.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of values from the following list: Category, DisplayName.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.list-filter-showing
parameter.description: Specifies the list of filters that an agent can use to search for contacts and internal targets by using the team communicator. The object types are presented in the specified order.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated value list of filter items to be displayed in the team communicator, for example: Agent,AgentGroup,Skill,RoutingPoint,Queue,Contact,InteractionQueue,CustomContact
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.list-status-reachable
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - List Of Reachable Status
parameter.description:
Specifies the list of statuses, excepting 'Ready', for which a target agent can be contacted for consultation, transfer, and conference, requests. If the status of the target agent is neither 'Ready' nor in the list of allowed statuses, the target agent will not be listed as available for consultation, transfer, and conference requests.
Note: Enabling 'LoggedOff' in this option typically applies to off-line media types like E-Mail.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of agent status from the following list: NotReady, LoggedOff, Busy
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.load-at-startup
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Load Elements At Startup
parameter.description: This option is used for performance issue at login time (when a lot of agents logs in at the same time). Specifies if all the configuration elements (Agents, Agent Groups, Queues, Routing Points, Skills) needed by Teamcommunicator are loaded at login time. If this option is set to false, the elements are no longer loaded at login time, but the 1st time the focus is placed in the Team Communicator.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.max-favorites-size
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries in the list of favorites that is displayed while an agent is entering a contact or target name in the favorites view. </BR>Note: High values (100+) will impact the performance of the workstation and application.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: Any positive integer value.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.max-suggestion-size
parameter.description:
Specifies the maximum number of internal entries (agent, agent groups and so on) and maximum number of external entries (customer contacts) to be displayed in the Team Communicator suggestion list while an agent is entering a contact or target name.
For example, if 10 is specified, up to 10 internal targets and up to 10 contacts may be displayed.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value from 1 through 50.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.queue-presence-metrics
parameter.description: Specifies a list of queue presence sections. Each of these sections contain a valid statistic name related to the queue, the text displayed in Team Communicator, a warning level value, an error level value, and a list of object ids that apply to this presence statistic.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a comma separated list of queue presence options section names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.recent-max-records
parameter.description: The number of recent internal targets to display in the list of recent targets.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value from 1 through 50.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.request-start-timer
parameter.description: Request start timer wait interval, in milliseconds, between the last key pressed and the beginning of the search through the contact database.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.
parameter.valid-description: An integer value from 1 through 5000.

parameter.name: teamcommunicator.routing-point-presence-metrics
parameter.description: Specifies a list of routing point presence sections. Each of these sections contain a valid statistic name related to the routing point, the text to be displayed in Team Communicator, a warning level value, an error level value, and a list of object ids that apply to this presence statistic.
parameter.valid-description: A string that contains a comma separated list of routing point presence options section names.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: teamlead.agent-status.enabled-agent-group-security-mode
parameter.displayName: Team Lead - Agent Status Enabled Agent Group Security Mode
parameter.description: Specifies that a Team Lead may change the status of an agent only if the agent is a member of an Agent Group that the Team Lead supervises. When set to false, any Team Lead can change the agent's status. Relies on the 'Team Lead - Can Change Agent Status' privilege being granted.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: teamlead.agent-status.enabled-remote-actions
parameter.displayName: Team Lead - Agent Status Enabled Remote Actions
parameter.description: Specified the list of agent status to which a Team Lead can set an agent selected from Team Communicator. This option is applicable only when privilege 'Team Lead - Can Change Agent State' is assigned to the Team Lead. Also this option defines the order of Team Communicator context menu items.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of strings from the following list: Ready, NotReady, LogOff

parameter.name: teamlead.monitoring-scope
parameter.description:
Specifies the scope of monitoring that is to be used for voice interactions in environments that use SIP Server.
  • call: The supervisor remains on the call until it is finished. This mode enables barge-in.
  • agent: System disconnects the supervisor automatically from the call when the monitored agent leaves the call. In this mode, the barge-in operation is not possible.
parameter.valid-description: Select a value from the following list: agent,call

parameter.name: toast.case-data.content
parameter.description:
Defines the content of the Case Information area in the toast interaction preview. The CaseData key enables the display of the attached data that is defined by the toast.case-data.format-business-attribute option. The History key enables the display of interaction history information. The order of the values defines the order of the Case Data and History information in the Case Information area of the toast.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy, as described in the Workspace Deployment Guide."

parameter.name: toast.case-data.format-business-attribute
parameter.displayName: Toast - Case Information Format Business Attribute
parameter.description:
Specifies the name of the Business Attribute that contains the Business Attribute Values that are used to filter and render attached data in the toast interaction preview.
This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
You can define the display order of Business Attribute Values by creating an interaction-workspace section in the annex of the Business Attribute, then add the toast.case-data.order option. This option is a comma-separated list of Business Attributes Value Names that specifies the order of the Business Attribute Values. The Attributes Values that are not listed in option toast.case-data.order are put at the bottom of the list.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.

parameter.name: toast.window-title
parameter.description: Defines the title of the Toast window by specifying a string that contains the following field codes:$Window.Title$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name). If all field codes are empty, the following field codes are used: '$Window.Title$ - $Interaction.MainParty$'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in the Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: $Window.Title$,$Agent.UserName$,$Agent.LastName$,$Agent.FirstName$,$Agent.EmployeeId$,$Interaction.CaseId$,$Interaction.MainParty$,$Contact.X$,$AttachedData.Y$ (X: name of contact attribute, Y: attached data key name).

parameter.name: views.CaseContactRegion.activate-order
parameter.displayName: Views - Selected Views Order In Region CaseContactRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the selected (or default) view in the specified region or specifies the order of a list view. If it exists, the first view is the default view. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): InteractionContactInformationView,InteractionContactHistoryView,...

parameter.name: views.CaseContactRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region CaseContactRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): InteractionContactInformationView,InteractionContactHistoryView,...

parameter.name: views.CaseViewSideButtonRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region CaseViewSideButtonRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): InteractionContainerSideButtonView,SRLSideButtonView,...

parameter.name: views.ContactInfoHistoryMultiRegion.activate-order
parameter.displayName: Views - Selected Views Order In Region ContactInfoHistoryMultiRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the selected (or default) view in the specified region or specifies the order of a list view. If it exists, the first view is the default one. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): ContactInformationView,ContactHistoryView,...

parameter.name: views.ContactInfoHistoryMultiRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region ContactInfoHistoryMultiRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): ContactInformationView,ContactHistoryView,...

parameter.name: views.ContactTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion.activate-order
parameter.displayName: Views - Selected Views Order In Region ContactTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the selected (or default) view in the specify region or specifies the order of a list of view. If it exists, the first view is the default one. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): ContactDetailView,ContactHistoryNotepadView,ContactHistoryCaseDataView,...

parameter.name: views.ContactTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region ContactTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): ContactDetailView,ContactHistoryNotepadView,ContactHistoryCaseDataView,...

parameter.name: views.InteractionDetailsRegion.activate-order
parameter.displayName: Views - Selected Views Order In Region InteractionDetailsRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the selected (or default) view in the specified region or specifies the order of a list view. If it exists, the first view is the default view. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): NotepadVoiceNotepadView,DispositionsView,...

parameter.name: views.InteractionDetailsRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region InteractionDetailsRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): DispositionsView,NotepadVoiceNotepadView,...

parameter.name: views.ToolbarWorkplaceRegion.activate-order
parameter.displayName: Views - Selected Views Order In Region ToolbarWorkplaceRegion
parameter.description: To indicate the selected (or default) view in the specified region, specifies an ordered list of view. If it exists, the first view is the default one. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): MyPlaceStatusView,myCampaignsListView,MyContactHistory,MyStatisticsView,MyCallCenterStatisticsView,...

parameter.name: views.ToolbarWorkplaceRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region ToolbarWorkplaceRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): MyPlaceStatusView,myCampaignsListView,MyContactHistory,MyStatisticsView,MyCallCenterStatisticsView,...

parameter.name: views.ToolbarWorksheetButtonRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region ToolbarWorksheetButtonRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): MyWorkplaceButtonView,MainToolbarWorkbinsContainerButtonView,MainToolbarContainerButtonView,MainToolbarContainerAlertMessageButtonView,...

parameter.name: views.WorkbinsTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion.activate-order
parameter.displayName: Views - Selected Views Order In Region WorkbinsTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the selected (or default) view in the specify region or specifies the order of a list view. If it exists, the first view is the default one. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): ContactDetailView,ContactHistoryNotepadView,ContactHistoryCaseDataView,...

parameter.name: views.WorkbinsTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion.order
parameter.displayName: Views - Views Order In Region WorkbinsTabBottomHistoryMultiRegion
parameter.description: Specifies the order of the views in the specified region. The following URL enumerates all the views and regions: http://docs.genesys.com/wiki/index.php?title=Category:Views_and_Regions
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of valid view names from the following list (plus the custom views): ContactDetailView,ContactHistoryNotepadView,ContactHistoryCaseDataView,...

parameter.name: voice.after-call-work-extension
parameter.displayName: Voice - Action On Second After Call Work
parameter.description:
In SIP Server environments, specifies the action to be performed if an agent repeatedly requests the After Call Work (ACW) status.
This does not apply to the IM channel which is always untimed.
  • untimed: Set an untimed ACW period (this is the default behavior for Workspace).
  • repeat: Allow an agent to extend the ACW period.
  • deny: Do not allow an agent to extend the current ACW period.
parameter.valid-description: One value from this list: untimed, repeat, deny

parameter.name: voice.auto-answer
parameter.displayName: Voice - Auto Answer Incoming Phone Call
parameter.description: Specify whether a voice interaction is automatically answered when a TServer Ringing event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: voice.cancel-after-call-work-on-done
parameter.displayName: Voice - Cancel After Call Work On Done
parameter.description: Specifies if the the voice channel should be forced to its former status when the agent marks the voice interaction as 'done' while his voice channel is in After Call Work status.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.complete-conference-requires-connected-consultation-call
parameter.displayName: Voice - Complete Conference Requires Connected Consultation Call
parameter.description: Specifies whether the 'Complete Conference' function requires consultation call to the Agent to be established. When this option is set to 'false', the Agent can complete conference regardless of consultation call state.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.dtmf-inactivity-typing-timeout
parameter.description: Defines the inactivity duration, in milliseconds, after which any buffered digits will be sent. A value of 0 means that each digit will be sent individually.
parameter.valid-description: from 0 to MAXINT

parameter.name: voice.enable-agent-reservation
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace should prevent an agent from setting manually his voice channel to 'not ready, 'do not disturb', 'after call work', 'logged off' status or from exiting the application when it has been marked as "Reserved" by Router or any other server able to reserve an Agent for call distribution.
parameter.valid-description: true, false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: voice.enable-init-conference
parameter.description: Specifies whether the 'Initiate Transfer' and 'Initiate Conference' functions are displayed as separate actions to the Agent in the 'Consultation' area. When this option is set to 'false', the single menu item 'Start Voice Consultation' is displayed. This menu item triggers the 'Initiate Transfer' function.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.end-consultation-method
parameter.description:
Specifies the type of telephony action that is executed when an agent clicks 'End' during a voice consultation call.
  • reconnect: A 'Reconnect Call' action is applied, which results in the automatic retrieval of the leg which was on hold during the consultation.
  • release: A 'Release Call' action is applied, which releases the consultation leg while keeping the principal leg on hold. This enables agents to make a subsequent consultation call without retrieving the main party first. Note: Genesys SIP Server supports this mode but not all switch environments can support it. For other switches, consult the corresponding documentation.
parameter.valid-description: reconnect, release

parameter.name: voice.hold-indicator-timer
parameter.description: Description: Defines two alarm thresholds, in seconds, that warn agents that a voice call is on hold for a long time. Three levels are displayed: before the warning time, between the warning time and the maximum time, and after the maximum time. "0,0" means that the progress indicator is not activated. This option can be enabled only if option voice.show-hold-duration is set to "true".
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list value: warning time, maximum time

parameter.name: voice.hot-standby.backup-retry-delay
parameter.description: In a hot-standby TServer configuration, this option specifies the time, in seconds, between the two attempts to reconnect to the back-up TServer.
parameter.valid-description: valid integer
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: voice.hybrid-switch-preference
parameter.description: In Hybrid environments where agents are configured to work with places containing Voice DNs from 2 distinct switches this option specifies a preference order to select the device to be used to make a call when multiple equivalent call paths are possible.
parameter.valid-description: A comma separated list of valid Switch Object names
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: voice.mark-done-on-release
parameter.description: Specify if an interaction should be closed automatically if a TServer Release event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.nb-max-independent-calls
parameter.displayName: Voice - Maximum Number Of Independent Calls
parameter.description: Specifies that an agent cannot place a new, independent call if the number of active calls is equal to or greater than the specified value. If the value 0 is specified, the agent is not prevented by Workspace from placing new calls; instead, the back-end system controls this behavior. This option does not affect consultation calls that are placed on top of voice calls.
parameter.valid-description: 0 or any positive integer.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: voice.one-step-trsf-mode
parameter.description: Specifies the type of one-step transfer. If you specify default, the one step transfer operation is 'single-step-transfer' when it is supported by your switch, or 'mute-transfer' if single step transfer is not supported by your switch.
parameter.valid-description: Select at least one item from the list.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: voice.prompt-for-end
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace displays a confirmation message when the agent clicks 'End'. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the voice channel ringing sound-configuration string. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: voice.show-hold-duration
parameter.description: Specifies if the current hold call duration should be displayed as the primary timer in the Interaction Bar when a voice call is placed on hold. The total call duration remains accessible through the Interaction Bar tooltip.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.show-post-call-duration
parameter.description: Specifies if the current post call duration should be displayed as the primary timer in the Interaction Bar when a voice call is disconnected. The past total call duration remains accessible through the Interaction Bar tooltip.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: voice.sip-preview-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the Voice (SIP Server only) or IM channel Preview sound-configuration string. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: voicemail.access-number
parameter.description: Specifies the number to call to access your voicemail system.
parameter.valid-description: Any valid DN
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: voicemail.notification-types
parameter.displayName: Voicemail - Types Of Mailboxes To Be Included In Message Waiting Indicator Counter
parameter.description: Specifies the types of voicemail boxes that will be included in the count of unread voicemail messages in the Main Window. The value personal refers to the voicemail box that is identified as the personal voicemail box of the agent. The value public refers to group voicemail boxes to which the agent has access.
parameter.valid-description: Comma-separated list of types from the following list: personal,public
parameter.effective-description: At next change of the counter value.

parameter.name: warm-standby.reconnection-random-delay-range
parameter.displayName: Warm Standby - Reconnection Random Delay Range
parameter.description: Specifies range of delay in seconds before reconnection to the last opened endpoint in case of disconnection.
parameter.valid-description: valid integer
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: warm-standby.retry-delay
parameter.description:
Specifies the delay, in seconds, that is applied after connections to all endpoints have been checked and failed, and before the next iteration is started.
This parameter could be overridden.
    In the Primary/Backup connection case, the Reconnect Timeout parameter of the Primary server is used. In case connection witout backup, this parameter could be defined in the option of the application (section interaction-workspace). In case Cluster Connection, this parameter could be defined in the option of cluster application (section interaction-workspace).
parameter.valid-description: valid integer
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted

parameter.name: webcallback.auto-answer
parameter.displayName: Web Callback - Auto Accept Incoming Web Callback Interaction
parameter.description: Specifies whether a Web Callback interaction is automatically accepted when Interaction Server Invite event is received. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: webcallback.auto-dial
parameter.description: Specifies whether Callback Phone Number is automatically dialed when an Interaction Web Callback is accepted. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: true, false

parameter.name: webcallback.callback-information.content
parameter.description: Defines the callback data that is displayed in the Callback Information Area. The callback data entries are displayed in the order in which they appear in the list.
parameter.valid-description: A comma separated list of items within the following list: Subject, PhoneNumber, Type, ScheduledDate, ContactTime, LocalTime, FormerAttempts, Result.

parameter.name: webcallback.callback-information.frame-color
parameter.displayName: Web Callback - Callback Information Header Color
parameter.description: Specifies the background color of the Callback Information view header of Web Callback interactions. Examples: #FFFFBA00 for a Gold color, #FF6F7074 for a Silver color, #FFB8400B for a Bronze color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: webcallback.callback-information.header-foreground-color
parameter.displayName: Web Callback - Callback Information Header Text Color
parameter.description: Specifies the color of the text of the Callback Information view header of Web Callback interactions. Example #FFFFFFFF for white color. This option can be overridden by a routing strategy as described in Deployment Guide.
parameter.valid-description: The hexadecimal Alpha (from '00' for fully transparent color to 'FF' for regular plain color) followed by the RGB hexadecimal color code (3 values in the '00'-'FF' range).

parameter.name: webcallback.complete-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which Web Callback interactions are placed when an agent marks one as processed.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: webcallback.park-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which the parent Web Callback interaction is placed when an agent transfers a voice call that is created from a Web Callback interaction.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: webcallback.reschedule-queue
parameter.description: Specifies the Interaction Queue in which Web Callback interactions are placed when an agent reschedules one and marks it as processed.
parameter.valid-description: Name of a valid Script of type Interaction Queue.

parameter.name: webcallback.ringing-bell
parameter.description:
Specifies the path of the sound file that is played when Web Callback interaction is delivered to the agent. For example: "Sounds\Ring.mp3|10|-1|primary" The value has four components that are separated by the character '|':
1) The file name and folder relative to the application folder. It may happen that on some virtual desktop, MP3 or other sounds format cannot be rendered by Direct Show filters. Files format that can be played (.wav, …) with Direct Show must be used here.
2) The priority. The higher the integer the higher the priority.
3) The duration:
a) -1 means plays and repeats until an explicit message stops it (I.e.: the established event stops the ringing sound).
b) 0 means play the whole sound one time.
c) An integer > 0 means a time, in milliseconds, to play and repeat the sound.
4) The output devices:
a) primary means plays on the default output device.
b) secondary means plays on the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
c) both means plays on both default output device and the output device specified by the option application.secondary-audio-out-device.
parameter.valid-description: All special characters that are valid Windows file path, '|' separator and numeric values.

parameter.name: webproxy.address
parameter.description: Specifies the web proxy host address that is used to download content from external web sites. This applies for example to the images that are contained in the e-mail body or to the pushed chat pages.
parameter.valid-description: An empty address to specify the default proxy configuration of Microsoft Internet Explorer, a valid proxy address (for example: http://my-proxy-server:3128), "None", or an invalid address to use no proxy at all.

parameter.name: webproxy.password
parameter.description: Specifies the password to be used to access the web proxy that is used to download content from external web sites. This applies for example to the images that are contained in the e-mail body or to the pushed chat pages.
parameter.valid-description: The password of the proxy credentials. Leave empty to not use any credentials.

parameter.name: webproxy.username
parameter.description: Specifies the username to be used to access the web proxy that is used to download content from external web sites. This applies for example to the images that are contained in the e-mail body or to the pushed chat pages.
parameter.valid-description: The username of the proxy credentials. Leave empty to not use any credentials.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.<workbin-nickname>
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Custom Workbin Declaration
parameter.description: The name of the workbin that is to be used to store interactions of a particular workitem media type. Agents can open interactions from this workbin but not save interactions in it.
parameter.valid-description: The name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Workbin.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.<workbin-nickname>.auto-update
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Enablement Of Content Update Registration For Custom Workbins
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace should register for updates in this workbin. It is recommended not to enable update registration on workbin containing large number of interactions and accessed by a large number of agents.
parameter.valid-description: true or false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.<workbin-nickname>.displayed-columns
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Displayed Columns Configuration Of Custom Workbin
parameter.description: The list of interaction fields that are displayed as columns of the specified workbin.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Interaction Server interaction properties, for example: From,Subject,Received
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.<workbin-nickname>.max-results
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Defining Max Interaction Number In Result Set For Custom Workbins
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of interactions returned by Interaction Server or Interaction Server Proxy when making a search query or a requesting the workbin content when workbin option 'auto-update' is set to 'false'. Interation Server 8.5.104.00 or above is required to get this option behave as documented.
parameter.valid-description: Any integer greater than 0.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.<workbin-nickname>.notify-property-changed
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template for Notify Property Changed options
parameter.description: Specifies whether Workspace should register for key-value pair updates of interactions stored in this workbin. It is recommended not to enable this kind of update registration on workbin containing a large number of interactions and accessed by a large number of agents.
parameter.valid-description: true or false
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.<workbin-nickname>.quick-search-attributes
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Defining Interaction Properties Used in Quick Search Of Custom Workbin
parameter.description: Specifies the list of interaction properties that are used to build the Quick Search query against Interaction Server when the agent makes a quick search in this workbin.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Interaction Server interaction properties, for example: AssignedTo,FromAddress
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.in-progress
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Declaration Of In Progress Workitem's Workbin
parameter.description: The name of the workbin to be used to store In-Progress workitems of the specified media type.
parameter.valid-description: The name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Workbin, that is owned by Agents.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.<media-type>.in-progress.displayed-columns
parameter.displayName: Workbin - Template For Displayed Columns Configuration Of In Progress Workitem's Workbin
parameter.description: The list of interaction fields that are displayed as columns of the workbin that stores In Progress workitems of specified media type.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Interaction Server interaction properties, for example: From,Subject,Received
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.email.draft
parameter.description: The name of the Workbin to be used to store draft e-mail.
parameter.valid-description: The name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Workbin that is owned by Agents.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.email.draft.displayed-columns
parameter.description: The list of interaction fields that are displayed as columns of the workbin that stores Draft e-mail interactions.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Interaction Server interaction properties, for example: From,Subject,Received
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.email.in-progress
parameter.description: The name of the workbin that is to be used to store inbound e-mail for later processing, after an agent explicitely saved the e-mail or submitted an outbound reply.
parameter.valid-description: The name of a valid Script object of type Interaction Workbin that is owned by Agents.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: workbin.email.in-progress.displayed-columns
parameter.displayName: Workbin - In Progress Workbin Displayed Columns
parameter.description: The list of interaction fields that are displayed as columns of the workbin that stores In-Progress e-mail interactions.
parameter.valid-description: A comma-separated list of Interaction Server interaction properties, for example: From,Subject,Received
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: error-level
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Error Level For Queue Presence
parameter.description: The value at which a statistic is considered to be at the upper threshold level.
parameter.valid-description: An integer or a double value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistic-name
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Statistic Name For Queue Presence
parameter.description: The name of the statistic used to evaluate presence for queues.
parameter.valid-description: A valid name of a statistic server statistic queue.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistic-text
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Text For Queue Presence
parameter.description: The text that is displayed beside the statistic value for queues.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: warning-level
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Warning Level For Queue Presence
parameter.description: The value at which a statistic is considered to be at the warning level.
parameter.valid-description: An integer or a double value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: error-level
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Error Level For Interaction Queue Presence
parameter.description: The value at which a statistic is considered to be at the upper threshold level.
parameter.valid-description: An integer or a double value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistic-name
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Statistic Name For Interaction Queue Presence
parameter.description: The name of the statistic that is used to evaluate interaction queue presence.
parameter.valid-description: A valid name of a Stat Server's statistic.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistic-text
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Text For Interaction Queue Presence
parameter.description: The text displayed beside the statistic value.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: warning-level
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Warning Level For Interaction Queue Presence
parameter.description: The value at which a statistic is considered to be at the warning level.
parameter.valid-description: An integer or a double value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: error-level
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Error Level For Routing Point Presence
parameter.description: The value at which a statistic is considered to be at the upper threshold level.
parameter.valid-description: An integer or a double value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistic-name
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Statistic Name For Routing Point Presence
parameter.description: The name of the statistic used to evaluate the presence for Routing Points.
parameter.valid-description: A valid name of a statistic server statistic queue.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: statistic-text
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Text For Routing Point Presence
parameter.description: The text displayed beside the statistic value.
parameter.valid-description: Letters A to Z and a to z. Numbers 0 through 9. The underscore and space characters.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

parameter.name: warning-level
parameter.displayName: Team Communicator - Warning Level For Routing Point Presence
parameter.description: The value at which a statistic is considered to be at the warning level.
parameter.valid-description: An integer or a double value.
parameter.effective-description: When the application is started or restarted.

group.name: IWMainToolbarTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the usage of Main Window in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.MainToolbar.canDock
task.displayName: Main Window - Can Dock The Main Window
task.description: The agent is permitted to dock the Main Window at the top edge of the screen.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.MainToolbar.canAutoHide
task.displayName: Main Window - Can Auto Hide The Main Window
task.description: When the Main Window is docked, it enables it to be auto hidden when the mouse cursor leaves the Main Window bounds. Depends on 'Main Window - Can dock the Main Window'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.InteractionBar.canUse
task.displayName: Main Window - Can Use Interaction Bar
task.description: Allows agent to use the Interaction Bar to keep shorcuts to open cases

group.name: IWVoiceTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the usage of voice channel in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canUse
task.description: The agent is permitted to use the voice channel. The other voice privileges cannot be configured if the value is Not Assigned

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canReleaseCall
task.description: Enables manual ending of voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canReconnectCall
task.description: The agent is permitted to manually end a voice consultation call. The behavior of this privilege depends on the option 'voice.end-consultation-method'. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canOneStepTransfer
task.description: Enables instant transfer of voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canTwoStepTransfer
task.description: Enables voice call transfer in two steps, started by a voice consultation. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canOneStepConference
task.description: Enables instant conference of voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canTwoStepConference
task.description: Enables voice call conference in two steps, started by a voice consultation. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canHoldRetrieveCall
task.description: Enables voice call hold then retrieve. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canSendDTMF
task.description: Enables sending DTMF during voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canSetInteractionDisposition
task.description: Allows agent to set a Disposition code during or after a voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canAnswerCall
task.description: Allows agent to answer manually an incoming voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canRejectCall
task.description: Allows agent to reject an incoming voice call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canForward
task.description: Allows agent to configure a call forward on his voice channel. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canMakeCall
task.description: Allows agent to make a new call from any area enabling this function. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.Monitoring.ShowSilentMonitoring
task.description: Lets agent be informed that current call is silently monitored by a supervisor. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canDeleteFromConference
task.description: Enables the initiator of a conference to delete a party from the conference. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canListenDisconnectReconnect
task.displayName: Voice - Can Suspend or Reinstate A Conference Party
task.description: Enables a conference member to suspend another member from the conference or reinstate a member to the conference. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'

group.name: IWWebCallbackTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the handling of Web Callback interactions in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canUse
task.displayName: Web Callback - Can Use Web Callback Channel
task.description: Allows agent to access to the Web Callback channel

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canDecline
task.description: Allows agent to decline incoming Web Callback interactions. Depends on 'Web Callback - Can Use Web Callback Channel'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canMarkDone
task.description: Allows agent to mark done inbound Web Callback without processing them further. Depends on 'Web Callback - Can Use Web Callback Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canReschedule
task.description: Allows agent to reschedule a Web Callback interaction. Use the 'Web Callback - Can Reschedule Before Call' privilege to allow rescheduling before the call is dialed. Depends on 'Web Callback - Can Use Web Callback Channel'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canRescheduleBeforeCall
task.displayName: Web Callback - Can Reschedule Before Call
task.description: Allows agent to reschedule a Web Callback Preview at a different date and/or time. The 'Web Callback - Can Reschedule' privilege must be enabled for this privilege to be active. If Can Reschedule is enabled but Can Reschedule Before Call is disabled, agents can still reschedule the Web Callback Preview after they have connected and disconnected the call. Depends on 'Web Callback - Can Reschedule'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canRescheduleOnNewNumber
task.displayName: Web Callback - Can Reschedule On New Number
task.description: Allows agent to reschedule a Web Callback interaction by using a new phone number. Depends on 'Web Callback - Can Use Web Callback Channel'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.WebCallback.canSetInteractionDisposition
task.displayName: Web Callback - Can Set Interaction Disposition
task.description: Allows agent to set the disposition code of Web Callback interactions. Depends on 'Web Callback - Can Use Web Callback Channel'.

group.name: IWIMTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the usage of instant messaging internal channel in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.IM.canUse
task.displayName: Instant Messaging - Can Use Instant Messaging Channel
task.description: Allows agent to use the instant messaging internal channel

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.IM.canReleaseIM
task.description: Enables manual ending of voice call. Depends on 'Instant Messaging - Can Use Instant Messaging Channel'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.IM.canMakeIM
task.description: Allows agent to create a new instant messaging session from any area enabling this function. Depends on 'Instant Messaging - Can Use Instant Messaging Channel'

group.name: IWStatisticsTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the usage of statistics in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.KPI.canUse
task.description: Allows access to agent statistics in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.ObjectStatistics.canUse
task.displayName: Statistics - Can Use Contact Center Statistics
task.description: Allows access to the Contact Center Statistics in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.GadgetStatistics.canUse
task.description: Allows access to the Statistic Gadget in Workspace

group.name: IWContactTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the access to contact directory and history in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUse
task.description: Allows access to the Contact features in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canMergeContact
task.description: Allows agent to merge two contacts. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUndoMergeContact
task.description: Allows agent to undo the merge of two contacts merged previously. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canMergeInteractionToContact
task.displayName: Contact - Can Merge Interaction To Contact
task.description: Allows agent to merge an interaction into an existing contact from the Contact History More Actions menu. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canMarkDoneVoiceInteraction
task.displayName: Contact - Can Mark Done Voice Interaction
task.description: Allows agent to mark done a voice interaction from the contact history. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canDeleteContact
task.description: Allows agent to delete contacts. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canCreateContact
task.description: Allows agent to create contacts. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactHistory
task.description: Allows agent to access contact history. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactInformation
task.description: Allows agent to access to contact profile. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactMyHistory
task.description: Allows agent to access the agent's own history with contacts. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactDirectory
task.description: Allows agent to view and search into contact directory. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactHistoryDetail
task.displayName: Contact - Can Use Contact History Detail
task.description: Allows agent to see the detail of interactions in contact history. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactHistoryNotePad
task.displayName: Contact - Can Use Contact History Notepad
task.description: Allows agent to see the notes about interactions in contact history. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseInteractionNotepad
task.description: Allows agent to display and edit the interaction notepad while handling an interaction or to display the interaction notepad in Workbins. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseContactHistoryCaseData
task.displayName: Contact - Can Use Contact History Case Data
task.description: Allows agent to see the case information of interactions in contact history. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseSaveContact
task.description: Allows agent to commit contact modifications. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canUseAssignContact
task.description: Allows agent to assign a contact to an interaction. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canPullFromQueue
task.description: Allows agent to pull interactions from queue from the Contact History view. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canPullFromSharedWorkbins
task.displayName: Contact - Can Pull Interactions In Shared Workbins
task.description: Allows agent to pull interactions from shared workbins which are not explicitly accessible to the user from the Contact History view. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canPullFromOtherPersonalWorkbins
task.displayName: Contact - Can Pull Interactions In Workbins Not Owned By The User
task.description: Allows agent to pull interactions from personal workbins which are not owned by the user from the Contact History view. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canAccessArchive
task.description: The agent is permitted to access the interaction archive in the My History and Contact History views. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contacts.canSearchArchive
task.description: The agent is permitted to search in the interaction archive in the My History and Contact History views. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use' and 'Contact - Can Access Archive'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Contact.CanSearchAllInteractions
task.description: The agent is permitted to search for any interaction available in Universal Contact Server index accross all contacts and all agents. Depends on 'Contact - Can Use'.

group.name: IWBroadcastMessgeTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the use of broadcasting in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.BroadcastMessage.canUse
task.description: Allows access to Message Broadcasting functions

group.name: IWWorkbinsTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the usage of workbins in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Workbins.canUse
task.description: The agent is permitted to access the My Workbins functions.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Workbins.canUseMyTeamWorkbins
task.displayName: Workbins - Can Use My Team Workbins
task.description: The agent is permitted to access the My Team Workbin functions.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Workbins.canSearch
task.description: Allows agents to search in workbins. Requires 'Workbins - Can Use My Workbins' or 'Workbins - Can Use My Team Workbins'.

group.name: IWInteractionManagementTasks
group.description: Privileges that are related to the use of Interaction Management features in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.InteractionManagement.canUse
task.description: The agent is permitted to access the interaction queue management functions.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.InteractionManagement.canMoveToQueue
task.displayName: Interaction Management - Can Move To Queue
task.description: The agent is permitted to move an interaction from a workbin or from a queue to a queue. Requires 'Workbins - Can Use My Workbins' or 'Workbins - Can Use My Team Workbins' or 'Interaction Management - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.InteractionManagement.canMoveToWorkbin
task.displayName: Interaction Management - Can Move To Workbin
task.description: The agent is permitted to move an interaction from a workbin or from a queue to a workbin. Requires 'Workbins - Can Use My Workbins' or 'Workbins - Can Use My Team Workbins' or 'Interaction Management - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.InteractionManagement.canEditCaseData
task.displayName: Interaction Management - Can Edit Case Information
task.description: The agent is permitted to edit the case information of an interaction in a queue or a workbin. Requires 'Workbins - Can Use My Workbins' or 'Workbins - Can Use My Team Workbins' or 'Interaction Management - Can Use'.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.InteractionManagement.InteractionQueues.canSearch
task.displayName: Interaction Management - Can Search In Interaction Queues
task.description: Allows agents to search in Interaction Queues. Requires 'Interaction Management - Can Use.'

group.name: IWSIPTasks
group.description: Privileges related to the usage of embedded SIP Endpoint in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.SIP.UseSIPEndpoint
task.displayName: SIP Endpoint - Can Use Embedded SIP Endpoint
task.description: Indicates if Workspace will start automatically an embedded SIP Endpoint for the SIP Agent. If set to false, you will require an external SIP Endpoint application.

group.name: IWRecordingTasks
group.description: Privileges that are related to call recording and screen capture in Workspace.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.ActiveRecording.canUse
task.displayName: Recording - Can Use MSML-based And Screen Recording
task.description:
This privilege is a pre-requisite to permit an agent to use the MSML-based and Screen Recording functionalities. This privilege is required to:
- Control and monitor call recording in MSML mode. In this case it depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'
- Enable screen recording.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.ActiveRecording.canUseScreenRecording
task.description: Allows a Workspace instance to activate a Screen Recorder Client when it is installed on the workstation. Depends on ‘Can Use MSML-based and Screen Recording

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canMonitorRecording
task.description: The agent is permitted display the status of a MSML-based recorded call. Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel' and 'Recording - Can Use MSML-based Recording'

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.Voice.canMakeEmergencyRecording
task.description:
The agent is permitted to control call recording (not available on all switches).
Depends on 'Voice - Can Use Voice Channel'
The type of recording depends on option active-recording.voice.recording-type which can be set to one of following:
"NETANN"(default) for NETANN-based recording
"MSML" for MSML-based recording. Depends on 'Recording - Can Use MSML-based Recording'

group.name: IWVoiceMailTasks
group.description: Privileges that are related to Voicemail in Workspace

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.VoiceMail.canUse
task.description: Allows agents to use the Voicemail functionality. This privilege is required to control and monitor Voice Mailboxes.

task.name: InteractionWorkspace.VoiceMail.canDepositVoicemail
